8.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2019
Ein sehr schönes First-Person Parkour Game.

Die Story habe ich nicht komplett verfolgt, da das Game auf Englisch ist und es keine deutschen Untertitel gibt. Aber selbst ohne genaues Wissen um was es geht, findet man gut zurecht und hat dennoch genug Spaß. Es ist auch kein 100%es Parkour Game, es bietet mehr. Es gibt Kämpfe, Dinge einzusammeln, Fähigkeiten verbessern und erhalten uvm.

Downward hat eine schöne Grafik und Soundtrack, Steuerung mit Tastatur und Maus gut, die Spielzeit ist genau richtig, man kann noch viel mehr Zeit im Spiel verbringen, wenn man einiges einsammelt. Aber es gibt auch noch sehr viele Challenges zu meistern. Technisch hatte ich keine FPS Drops bei max. Einstellungen, nur einmal bin ich festgebuggt, ansonsten keine Probleme.

Recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Ho ricevuto una copia gratuita del gioco grazie ad Indiegala e visto che mi incuriosiva particolarmente l'ho provato.

Ecco le mie impressioni:

Il gioco offre una mappa particolarmente grande, molto dettagliata e disseminata di collezionabili che permettono di potenziare il nostro alter ego sia aumentando le sue resistenze che sbloccando nuove abilità. L'area di gioco è esplorabile attraverso l'utilizzo di alcune mosse di parkour (come le wallrun e i wall jump) ed offre una certa libertà al giocatore, visto che sono presenti diverse vie alternative.

I comandi rispondono in maniera veloce, anche se i salti devono essere calibrati ♥♥♥ una certa precisione, forse anche troppa. Nonostante questo problema, è possibile salvare la propria posizione e teletrasportarci indietro, nel caso qualcosa vada storto.
Esistono anche dei combattimenti, sebbene questi siano abbastanza facili, una volta capito come affrontare il tipo di nemico corrispondente.

Per quanto riguarda il comparto grafico, il particolare stile di ambientazione adottato dagli sviluppatori, unito alla potenza dell'Unreal Engine 4, offre degli scorci suggestivi e molto belli da vedere, tuttavia ogni tanto ho riscontrato cali di framerate anche sostanziali.

La storia del gioco è raccontata attraverso delle piccole cutscene, interagendo ♥♥♥ gli npc e leggendo le descrizioni degli oggetti trovati.

In sostanza l'ho trovato un ottimo gioco per lo stato in cui si trova attualmente, considerando che è stato sviluppato solo da 3 ragazzi.

Per ulteriori informazioni ho fatto una breve video recensione reperibile a questo link:
Vidéo YouTube™: Downward - Review Tecnica (ALPHA) 
Vues : 1,046
Bentrovati in questa review tecnica di Downward, un gioco italiano dal peculiare gameplay sviluppato dalla Caracal Games, volta soprattutto ai developers stessi, che mira ai punti chiave delle...

Recommandé
0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2017
UE4製の美麗グラフィックパルクールアクション。
画質は現行のあらゆるゲームの中でもトップクラス。

アクションゲーとしては一般的なパルクールで、ダッシュや壁ジャンプなどを駆使して先を目指す。
セーブ機能やリトライ機能も十分で、ストレス少なく遊べるようになっている。
収集アイテムなどもあり、アーリーながらバランスの取れたゲーム。
お値段相当感は十分に感じられた。

ただし、個人的にはFPS視点のゲームの中でも特に酔いやすかったのが唯一の難点として挙げられる。
ゲーム酔いする人は注意した方が良いかもしれない。
歩く動作一つ取ってもリアルな揺れが起こるため、一度酔い始めると苦しい。


既に十分良くできているゲームなので、トレーラーを見て気になったら遊んでみてもいいかもしれない。

Sauza
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2017
Довольно интересный симулятор паркура в античном антураже. Движок Unreal Engine 4 показывает старания местных художников, и атмосфера действительно завораживает. Сам паркур вполне неплох, учитывая что команда небольшая, у них получилось все очень хорошо. Механика напоминает Mirror's Edge с дополнением некоторых примочек (прыжок на вихрь, который поднимает вверх, создание временных поверхностей в процессе бега). Также на мир влияют так называемые планеты, которых здесь три. Делая акцент на каждой из них, вы можете проникнуть в неизведанные ранее места и собрать артефакты.

Достоинства
+Используемый движок и то, что с его помощью сделали - я про местное окружение
+Адекватный паркур и дополнения к нему
+Изменяемые окружения (планета Гамма поднимает в воздух камни, планета Альфа - поднимает уровень воды)
+Коллекционирование предметов (есть мотивация побегать в разные уголки карты)
+Логичная идея с перемещением (разный цвет поверхности позволяет понять, что надо с ними делать - забираться, отпрыгивать или бежать по ним)

Недостатки. Сразу скажу, что несмотря на то, что их много, но они не сильно портят впечатление от игры.
-Настройки игры. Сглаживание и блум надо отключать через консоль, неудобно
-Размытие. Действительно помогает сгладить игру, без него кажется, что игра сильно тормозит (как ни странно)
-Баги разного характера. Игру похоже мало тестировали, удавалось включать планеты, когда по сюжету был запрет на это, провалы в текстуры, прогрузка окружения.
-Ненужность некоторых локаций. Есть пара локаций с черепом (кто это, узнаете сами) и стариком (его логово, которое можно изменять). Можно туда вообще не забегать в принципе (но похоже, это может привести к изменению концовок, которых тут три)
-Ненужность дерева навыков. Можете пройти игру без траты местной валюты ради навыков.
-Мало описывается сам мир. Это делается через предметы или диалоги персонажей, которых тут трое + главный герой.
-Один музыкальный трек при бое. ОДИН, КАРЛ!!!. Немного раздражает.
-Есть разные големы, с которыми надо сражаться, но они все одинаково одолеваются. (подбежал, чтобы он атаковал -отбежал при атаке, камни на его спине стали синими - подбежал и отсоединил их)

Недочеты произошли из-за небольшого количества разработчиков (на сайте написано, что их трое), но они решили поконкурировать с редкими играми такого жанра и у них в целом получилось.
6,5/10
 
Cheet@hRus
419 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
11.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2018
The trailers don't do it justice.
If you like first-person games, but you don't need to kill things to enjoy it, you'll love this.
This is Mirror's Edge Catalyst on a different planet and without an 'enemy'. You run around and explore (at high speed), while fulfilling some needs; mostly you run around and explore at high speed.
The voice acting is there to keep the story moving, but really, it's about running around at full speed.
Fun as ♥♥♥♥. Period.
I love it.

Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2019
Good graphics, and game play, though the level design could be a bit more intuitive at times. Some of the levels I really enjoyed, and breezed though, some not so much. I found myself wandering around quite a bit, and wondering whether I should be there or not. I would call it bad pacing issues or bugs at worst. At it's core though, this is a pretty challenging and unique 3D platformer and worth a try even though some of the mechanics can be save-scummed, and with the level design being as clunky as it is.

Get it on sale, spend a few hours with it, you'll probably enjoy it if you like platformers.
 
pravin

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 octobre 2018
+Fun parkour game with interesting mechanics
+Exploring is actually fun in this game.
+The "Mark" mechanic lets you drop a finite number of teleport points which you can then teleport to an infinite number of times. Makes exploring and experimenting with the movements more forgiving and more importantly, fun.
+Lots of progression : Skill trees, upgradable rooms
+Actually fun collectibles.Also, you dont need to collect every single piece for the achievements.

-Endings are FeelsWeirdMan
-Brightness is all over the place. Some rooms are so dark, you cant even see the save point. And some other areas ( like the challenges) are so bright, the anomalies(interactable points) blend in with the environment (It did get a little easier to see when i increased the effects option in the graphics).
-Frame rate is pretty bad. Rarely a constant 60. Drops going as low as 25 even. But for the most part stuck about 40-50. Had to play with reduced graphics.

Definitely scratched my itch for parkour first person games at the moment.
 
Revenant
415 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2020
It's OK. There is some fun to be had here, but this whole game - or at least as much as I felt like playing - just feels very rough, and it's obvious this isn't a particularly experienced developer.

The graphics are decent. The controls are acceptable. The story is bland. The clarity of purpose is missing. You just ... don't ever really feel like you're accomplishing anything in this game. You can explore, and then you'll find that there's no point until the game wants you to. Following the actual story doesn't really give any more of a sense of accomplishment, either.

This game isn't really *bad*, it's just not particularly *good*, either. It has a lot of potential that it never lives up to, and if you're like me, you'll enjoy the opening hour or two, get out of that area, and then just kind of stop caring.
 
Lord Dyran

Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Очень интересная, визуально привлекательная и достаточно красивая игра, в жанре паркур-адвенчура от первого лица.
В роли некого путника вам предстоит исследовать многочисленные таинственные локации, находить и собирать артефакты, которые могут быть использованы в различных ситуациях и играть ключевую роль в решении головоломок.
Сами головоломки в игре так же являются немаловажным игровым элементом.
Довольно обширная карта, заявленная как open-world, с большим количеством скрытых тайничков. Путешествовать придется много, все исследования и поиски будут сопровождаться захватывающими дух пейзажами, а переходы в астральные миры позволят практиковаться в искусстве паркура и зарабатывать средства на прокачку скилов.
Управление не сложное, трудностей не возникло, с учетом того, что все подсвечено маркерами, понятно куда бежать и что делать, а походу прохождения присутствуют чек-поинты.
Учитывая то, что в данный момент игра находится на стадии раннего доступа, уже четко определенно можно сказать о перспективе и очевидном потенциале достичь отличных успехов.
 
TriAD
2,043 produits enregistrés
2
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Premettendo che ho giocato solo per un'ora a questo gioco e quindi non posso dire ♥♥♥ certezza tutto quello che ha in se, in questo breve lasso di tempo posso sicuramente dire che il gioco è molto bello, funziona, è divertente, ottimo gameplay e meccaniche, un'ottima colonna sonora. Ricorda molto Mirror's Edge e Dishonored. Per quanto le ambientazioni possano sembrare sempre le stesse non lo sono, ci sono vie multiple, ci sono collezionabili, c'è un bel po' di esplorazione, la storia viene raccontata tramite delle brevi cutscene, tramite le descrizioni dei collezionabili che troviamo e tramite i dialoghi ♥♥♥ gli npc. In più che dire c'è anche il doppiaggio di ThePruld e Livia per soli 10 euro questo gioco è una miniera d'oro.

115.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juin 2018
Love when I stumble upon a game like this. I intended this game to be for my 11 year old daughter and kinda took it over. Bad dad. im not sorry. Probably the most fun Ive had since Talos Principle. Like a lot of players I thought something was wrong with the game after a few hours. I just wasnt paying enough attention, and brought my own expectations from similar games and tried to apply them here. Square peg vs round hole = hammer, repeat, hit thumb ....finally insight lol. If you are patient, observant, and thoughtful the game will unfold and all skills / areas/ paths evntually become clear.

While not a perfectly polished game, it is well worth the price. Ive spent several hours exploring the world of downward and its mechanics. Time spent engaged and always looking for one more hard to reach spot. Not simply a parkour game.

Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Перед Вами симулятор паркура с видом от первого лица. Выполненная в средневековой атмосфере, в стиле древних руин, напоминает нам некий постапокалипсис (только без зомби).

Совмещая элементы паркура, Вам предстоит решать различного рода головоломки для прохождения игры.
Разработчик акцентирует внимание будущих игроков на изучение локаций, истории древнего мира, классического искусства.

«Для нас библейский конец света — всего лишь возможность показать, как развивалось человеческое общество после 1000 года нашей эры, когда наш мир и мир Downward разделились» (c) Caracal Games

11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
47.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juin 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Start off good, this game is currently unfinished, but it is by no mean unpolished. This small group of 3 people from Rome have blown me away with their amazing work, and fine eye for detail. I refund a lot of games, and after my first 5 minutes I knew I would be hooked! The character controller feels very smooth, and apart from a couple game breaking glitches that make you have restart your file (game is early access, what can you do) this game is well on it's way to being a full release. This game feels like it draws heavy inspiration from Mirror's Edge on it's parkour mechanics, yet it's cues are a little more subtle. Given the open world, you may find yourself going off track to explore, and does this game ever let you. A couple areas of the story are accessable early and give a ton of perks as well as a sneak peek at story elements if you so desire. The story is a little lacking, though by the end of the current plot I do find myself drawn in enough to want to know how it ends.

Now let's talk about the bad, because there is a bit. The parkour is a little unrefined. Don't get me wrong, most of the time you will find it being flawless, however there are currently a few early access bugs that cause the character to react automatically to some wall cues and mess up your input (This never bugged me too much on my playthrough). Another flaw is the open world itself. The quest cues are a little confusing, at least they were for me until I explored just about the entire map and found my way into areas I shouldn't have been yet. Although it was really fun finding extra areas before completing the first story arch.

If you enjoy parkour style games, don't mind a bit of added action, and love exploring well thought out worlds, I would highly recommend this game to you.
 
DeepFriedOreo

2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2017
Downward
E da un po che sentivo parlare di questo gioco la prima volta fù però su Facebook da parti di Gametime,
rimasi stupito perchè lessi che questo gioco e in sviluppo da un gruppo di italiani.
e mi dissi : ''ANDIAMO A VEDERE SU STEAM''.
appena vidi il trailer rimasi stupito dallo stile originale e dalla grafica fantastica visto che il gioco gira su Ureal Engine 4.
beh proprio oggi ho deciso di prenderlo e solo dopo 28 minuti di gioco devo dire che....................................................
è bellissimo perche mi ricorda Price of Persia sia per il parkour che per il fatto che per curarsi bisogna bere dallla fontana come in p.o.p. ma anche per la narrazione sia in inglese sia in italiano che sono a dir'poco stuopende e fatte veramente bene senza parlare del gameplay che lo caratterizza moltissimo come la raccolta dei frammenti i poteri e i personaggi.
Il personaggio che usiamo a me personalmente piace molto! per l'interpretazione che offre.
molti lo hanno giudicato male senza nessun senso!
molti criticano perche in fase beta e alpha aveva dei problemi...(cosa al quanto normale per qusi qualsiasi titolo in fase pre.)
io questo gioco spero che diventi un giorno famoso perchè ha veramente tutte le staffe per diventare anche un giorno un gioco da console!
ma anche da compete contro Little Nigthmare che pure essendo due generi diversi sono pur'sempre due Indie.

il mio voto è 100 su 100!
Grazie per l'attenzione!

LINK VIDEO:
Vidéo YouTube™:

After working around a nvidia related driver issue I finally got to play the game. Also the developers got in contact with me and helped me out. Really nice guys that care about their community.

So what I can say so far is:
-the game has really stunning graphics and a lot of detail went in there
-the parcour movement system works mostly fluently but still could use a bit polishing
-the voice acting is greatly done!
-the storytelling makes me want to find out what happened in that world

If you like parcour games with challenges, this is just the perfect game for you.

Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2017
首先谈谈这游戏的优点：
1、画面色调搭配很好，视觉效果很舒心。
2、地图的可探索性比较强。
3、各地图有不同风格的风景，不易视觉疲劳。
缺点：
1、BUG超多！才刚玩不长时间就好多次卡到墙内出不来！然后有要退出从存档点重开。我捡到8个彩色盒子的时候又卡到墙里去了，重开，盒子变回3个。。。
2、第一视觉一开始感觉还好，但是遇到某些游戏情况，镜头就晃动得厉害，容易造成眩晕。
3、游戏声音太过单调。

First person post apocalyptic version of Super Mario with parkour. Very resource-heavy but very nice to see and hear despite some small glitches. It is all in all a simple game but it has a fun gameplay and a quite compelling story to me. It's not a perfect game but if you like games like Mirror's Edge you will love it.

Recommandé
11.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2019
Broken but beautiful
As one of the most buggy game I have ever played, It shocks me when I find myself really enjoys this game and I can't tell why
The concepts in this game definitely can't be considered as original but are well thought out for most parts of the game
There are many cheeky exploits but not game breaking (while some of the bugs are). You might even feel like achieving something when you pull them off.
The graphic is astonishing from time to time. However the whole "changing the planet" thing really didn't add much to the visual (Sometimes I think it would be much better if they just scrap it completely)
The gameplay loop is repetitive but satisfying. It is intriguing enough to keep me hooked for several hours
Progression system is not well balanced. Some of the upgrades are completely overpowered while some others are utterly useless.
Objectively speaking, its a heavily flawed game. However, considering the fact that i did have a good time; I would still give it a thumbs up (3.5/5)
 
Big Uncle
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2018
Enjoyable first-person puzzle platformer (probably about 80% platforming, 20% puzzle-solving). The game looks nice, has some good level design and fun exploration. The controls feel pretty solid and although there is precision platforming, it's never frustrating. You have generous amount of air control and ledge grab leeway and if that fails, you can always teleport back to your last marked position. As you progress through the game, you gain new traversal abilities that allow you to reach previously inaccessible areas. You also gain the ability to switch between planetary phases which can alter the environments in pretty significant ways. As with the traversal abilities, these open up new paths and encourage you to revisit areas.

On the downside, the combat feels tacked on. It's very one-note and more of an annoyance than anything else. Honestly, they could have left it out entirely and the game would have been better for it. Finally, there is a story but it's pretty incoherent and not especially compelling. You'll be playing this for the gameplay, not the narrative.
 
Uglzorp
4,090 produits enregistrés
0

4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 avril 2018
Early impressions only an hour in and I'm very impressed by the quality and polish of this game. For an indie title it's an excellent shot at an open world adventure, with surprisingly good voice acting and truly beautiful graphics.

It's a mix of Mirror's Edge with its parkour... actually it's mainly Mirror's Edge but in a more fantasy 'other worldly' setting.

I'm not deep enough in to make a proper assessment but so far is really great.

I'll update in due course.

EDIT Played a bit more and it's holding up - actually getting even better. For an indie game it's a pretty incredible piece of work.
 
Danny_G13

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2018
Я очнулся на краю полупрозрачной платформы, висящей высоко над залитым солнцем морем. Единственный путь - прыжок через пропасть к следующему островку безопасности. Раньше никогда бы на него не решился, но сейчас совершаю это без проблем. Мое тело легкое, быстрое и сильное. Так что я продолжаю и дальше перепрыгивать с одной площадки до другой и карабкаться по странным блестящим колоннам. Все выше и выше пока не становиться очевидным, что дальше двигаться некуда.

"Прыгай..." - "Что? Кто это говорит?" - "Прыгай! Доверься мне..." - " Но здесь же несколько десятков метров! Ау, загадочный голос, ты всё еще здесь?" Полагаю у меня всё равно нет выбора. По крайней мере именно в падении чувствуется какая-то свобода. Последняя мысль: "Как же страшно красиво вокруг" Плюх!


Примерно так, наверное, это должно работать. Главный герой тут постоянно задается вопросами: "Кто я? Где я? Зачем я?" "Ну, надо же! Мои мысли как будто читают" - думаю я - "Четвертая стена рухнула и волшебный мир Dawnward словно втягивает меня в себя." Поначалу может быть так оно и есть, да и игра действительно чeртoвски приятно выглядит. Но, когда спустя три часа вместо сюжета протагонист всё так же спрашивает о том: "Могу ли я? Хочу ли я?" - начинаешь потихоньку раздражаться и вместо того, чтобы просто получать удовольствие, все больше анализировать, что же из себя представляет игра. А переставляет она базовый паркур в небольшом открытом мире, разделенном на четыре зоны. Где вся пьянящая поначалу свобода оборачивается короткой и не напрягающей прогулкой. В Dawnward вообще всё слишком легко даётся.

Вот, к примеру, бои: типов врагов всего два и про один из них (летающих в воздухе дронов) говорить просто нечего, а значит остаются только големы. Голем - это такое большое глупое тело, которое на игрока медленно надвигаются, пытается ударить, а потом, очевидно с досады, бьет по земле. В этот момент нужно подбежать и выдернуть из спины куб (бывает от 2 до 4). Почему оно именно пытается ударить? Да потому, что есть рывок (dash) - пробегаете мимо, нажимаете одну кнопку, повторяете, если нужно - всё, победа. Хорошо, первый раз это весело. Может быть даже второй и третий. На десятый это уже разочаровывающе просто. На двадцатый (я не шучу!) - начинает тошнить.

Можно было бы большую часть из них пропустить, но те кубы, оказываются "важным" ресурсом, при помощи которого убираются специальные барьеры. Т.е. должно получаться наподобие метроида - "Вернись, когда у тебя будет достаточно ресурсов". Почему не получается? Да потому, что дефицит ощущается только первые двадцать минут, дальше этих кубов будет так много, что ни одна преграда больше не будет проблемой. Но собирать еще можно ради альтернативной концовки. Я вытерпел и получил в награду пару лишних предложений, а потому могу честно сказать - оно того не стоило.

Не стоило обращать внимание и на ролевую систему. Во-первых, это самообман: ломается она без всяких читов - достаточно выйти из одной зоны в другую, а потом обратно и все кругом разбросанные сферы с опытом опять окажутся на своих местах. Во-вторых, рудимент: потратить очки на способность, чтобы при помощи нее получать больше очков - такое терпеть нет уже никаких сил. В-третьих, она не нужна: единственное на что стоит обратить внимание - быстрое перемещение между локациями, а для всяких "+25% к здоровью" игра слишком элементарная.


Иногда Dawnward все же вырывала из рутинного крохоборства, здесь и правда очень красиво: то парящие в небе заснеженные острова, то завораживающий свет в пещерах, а смена окружения планет выглядит просто потрясающе - резко поднимается уровень воды или от земли отрываются и взмывают вверх новые куски скал, или вообще день превращается в ночь. Но только заниматься тут чем? Бесконечным собирательством, в том числе коллекционных предметов. А ради чего? Ах, да, за это дают еще немножко опыта.
 
Andrei32167
459 produits enregistrés
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 septembre 2017
Overall:
Absolutely amazing. Fun and unique. The worlds are captivating and fun to explore. The gameplay is great and has plenty variety in terms of game mechanics and environments to keep the player entertained. Some of the puzzles are nice and challenging; they force the player to think. The story develops genuine curiosity and the desire to learn more. Dialogue with the NPCs is humorous. Would recommend to anyone (and I have)!

Gameplay:
The parkour is great. The game mechanics build on one another and eventually combine to make some nice challenging puzzles. The combat falls short and was pretty boring, but it's not a main focus of the game so it doesn't detract too much from the overall gameplay. Would be nice if there were some more complex puzzles that involve moving platforms or timing, or real-time reaction speed. There is SOME of this, but for the most part you can look at a puzzle and figure out what needs to be done.

Level Design:
Each world has its own personality and feel to it. The use of the 4 planets is very creative. They drastically change certain parts of the world and allow the player to explore new areas. It would be better if the choice of planet wasn't so obvious, or if there were more places to combine the use of the planets.

Story:
The few characters that are in the game are very captivating and keep the player wanting to learn more. The idea to put multiple endings for each NPC was great; it is a nice reward for extra exploration. The issue is that the endings are quite ambiguous, and the true meaning of the world is never REALLY revealed.
 
friartucc

Évaluation publiée le 28 février 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

I played the early access version of the game and I'm excited for the release of the final version. Great atmosphere, smooth gameplay. Maybe too heavy on the bloom effect in places as it makes some of the important things like artifacts hard to see. Also, some areas are nearly pitch black. Contrast too high? Also some crashing. But as it's early access I can forgive all that. All in all, very good! Kind of like a parkour metroidvania with a Myst-like beauty.

6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2016
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Honestly:

♥♥♥♥ first:
I was a little disappointed in terms of how linear it was. I was hoping for more of an exploratory, multi-pathed thing with lots of places to explore but it's kind of straightforward, with really obvious goal markers, and single paths. This can, of course, all change when it moves form EA.

However the biggest issue is... the main character's voice-acting. Not the actor themselves exactly, but it seems really awkward and forced given the context- it's also slightly too loud cmpared to ambient sounds (haven't looked into adjusting the sound yet if I can change the different levels but at default) and sort of tears me away from the immersion at times. A few lines are really sort of unnerving:I mean, if the main character's lived in the world for however long he has (the main character is an adult); he obviously cannot be as ignorant of things as the tutorial-style intro makes it out to be. He gets confused about finding artifacts and is like ?!??!! WHAT ARE THOSE whenever he runs into a new enemy (which seem to be fairly widespread- really, he's never seen one of them before?). Also, some things are never even explained but he totes knows what's up with those guys. It's a bit contradictory. This is also coming from the fact that he is already on a 'journey' and probably has some goals in mind. Honestly, I feel like I'm playing an absolute idiot most of the time. I haven't gotten too far yet; but he seems really, really ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ stupid. Not to mention that he talks about how rare people are; yet he can speak a language that everyone understands. Where did he learn it from? He had to have parents or an origin or something, they must have taught him some other things! Why is he so stupid when he's talking?

I'd highly suggest them re-writing and re-recording most of his dialogue, because it just seems really weird. I do really enjoy the lines he says when you find an artifact though- those are hilarious. Some folks here (after reading the other reviews and editing mine a bit) complain about his lack of emotion- hoenstly I find the deadpan execution quite funny. However, they are right- he should be a little more invested when it comes to the actual storyline. VERY IMPORTANT: The voice-actor himself is GOOD. It's not about him- it's just.. the dialogue lines themelves are really awakward and umeotional.

Also, for being a parkour game, the grab-edges are kinda.. awkward? and it's really easy to miss things for really stupid reasons. Maybe I am just bad at games, but it's hard to tell where the cut off point is. And, with it being first-person (and not third person like assasin's creed), it's hard to tell where your feet are when running - and you can't look down because you tend to move whereever youre looking towards).

Lastly, ****[early-game spoilers begin here], when finding the shrine for the first time, and the first door gets opened, I was really confused because of how far away it was in the end. It was really awkward to run all the way across the map and having to get down from up ther ewas really awkward (pipe-passage shortcut I did not go to, as I thought the door would be somewhere else so I went past it a little). Also, I was not too sure what exactly I accomplished going through that first area.

[spoiles are over]****



Pros:

This game actually reminds me quite a lot of old-school Playstation and Gamecube games- like Spyro. The nostalgia's really strong with the way it's been developed and played. Honestly, I'm really digging that. Modern games have gone in the wrong direction at times, and it's mnice to see a straight-forward, item-collecting-y type thing to play. It's something I just enjoy. I'm not very good at developing good battle strategies or complex fights- like Dark Souls at the worst. This is so simple and just has these really nice basic elements to it; but with the modern graphics. It's really nice for me to play it. It's just something I could pick up and gothrough. Maybe this is a ♥♥♥ for some people, but I really like it. It gives me a break ffrom really hard-core RPGs and complex stuff. It's just nice to play, though I wish the storyline was a little darker.

The landscapes are also amazing! I actually find the world really beautiful, though some of the foliage could use an upgrade (specifically in the frozen area).

Lastly for pros, I really like how progress is saved. I really like finally getting to an object, and even if I die I still retain it. I'm not sure if it's intentional, but it takes off a lot of stress about falling. Losing SKypieces really isn't an issue, but it's nice to see that all my collectibles save regardless of where I go.

All in all, I'm actually enjoying it quite a bit, thouigh don't go into this expecting a really deep complex game juuust yet.
 
Beefsen
1,430 produits enregistrés
0

Produit remboursé

This really seemed like I was going to love it, but there are some things I can't get over and couldn't continue with. The parkour is obviously meant to be the main focus, but it's waaayyy too unreliable to get any enjoyment out of. It's much more frustrating than anything, repeating the same little supposedly-easy section over and over just because the wall-jump just won't work. Also, I think this game actually suffers from its somewhat poor implementation of Open World. On top of that; collecting the blue floaty things I forgot the name of, "fighting" golems, listening to the dialogue; it all just feels like a chore. Won't be coming back to this one unfortunately.

Hey but it's pretty I guess.

Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2016
Produit remboursé

Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Overall, very visually appealing and good looking, but I'm not even very far in and it's showing its flaws. The parkour system seems like it doesn't extend to everything; as i've found, you can only climb specific objects and on specific sides. Some walls will let you wall jump when you want to wall run. The game's mechanics and "rules" should be kept universally, not picky and choosy on which objects you can parkour with. I played around in meditation mode a bit and it was frustrating that I couldn't take on obstacles in my own way and was forced to go through the linear obstacle course set up by the mapmaker.

Another thing is the voice acting, mainly for the protagonist. Gah, he sounds like a radio announcer in EVERY sentence. He's doing a weird voice and none of his lines seem to have emotion. I know that's credit partly to how it's written but it's just very unimpressive.

The game's got a long way to go and a lot of polishing to be done.

You dont need a high end pc to be able to enjoy the view of the game and run around exploring this detailed world with some funny littel easter eggs and achievements, carefull with cacteens in this game ;)

Hell the game even has a demo u can play before deciding if its a gametype for u or not so just try it out

Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2017
Hier mein Review zum Spiel "Downward" nach 1 Stunde im Spiel.

Das Spiel ist in meinen Augen große Klasse.
Die Grafik läuft soweit super spielbar in Ultra-Einstellungen bei FullHD.
Sollte jemand eine minimalistische Hardware haben ... das spiel sieht auch in niedrigeren Einstellungen durchaus ansehnlich aus ... jedoch entfaltet die Unreal Engine 4 ihre volle Schönheit erst richtig mit allem auf Maximum.
Die Steuerung ist mit Maus und Tastatur gut gelungen und ich habe als alter PC-Hase keinerlei Probleme mich durch die Gegend zu hupfen und zu dschumpen ... somit kann ich zu einem Controller kein Kommentar abgeben. :-)
Die Geschichte ist soweit OK und dümpelt so vor sich hin.
Aber mal ehrlich ... es ist ein JumpNRun in 3D ... was will ich da groß mit einer Adventure-Story?!
Der Preis im Angebot mit derzeit 7 Euro und ein paar Tacken ist mehr als fair und für das Spiel mehr als gerechtfertigt.
Selbst der reguläre Preis ist angemessen.
Da habe ich schon wesentlich unfaireres erlebt.

Wer also auf Sprung-Akrobatik ... Erkundung ... hübsche Optik ... Inselromantik ... Wert legt kommt hier auf seine Kosten.
Allerdings sind die bisherigen Jumps sehr einfach gemacht.
Kann sein das es für Finger-Akrobaten-Fans im Laufe des Spiels heftiger wird.
Wenn nicht werden diese Leute vermutlich enttäuscht sein.
Ich für meinen Teil hoffe das es nicht heftiger wird.
Sprung-Stile und Variationen hin oder her ... aber man sollte dennoch keinen Finger-Krebs bekommen bei den Tastenkombis wie in einigen anderen Spielen.
Wer sowas mag soll in meinen Augen Fischerknoten lernen oder sich auf Gicht einstellen. :-D
Ich für meinen Teil finde das Spiel gelungen.
Klarer Daumen hoch.
 
Rongkong Coma
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 octobre 2018
Games like this are bread and buttewr for me, ever since I played Turrican as a child: large open worlds with lots of hidden areas to discover. Switches that change previously explored areas allowing new access. Stuff to collect. Enemies that are largely avoidable. Pretty graphics. Weird characters. Mysterious plot that's revealed as you progress.

Reminiscent of the equally great Valley, except without the suit and the industrial pollution. This is a fantasy game, says it's post apocalyptic, but that's in the sense that something horrible happened to the world that left it in ruins. It's all old citadels and temples. No old nuclear bunkers or rusty vehicles. It's a world full of forgotten trinkets and artifacts.

My main gripes after playing it to the end are the bugs; I got stuck in scenery a few times. Sometimes my character was locked in the jump pose while on the ground and only had a restricted ability to move. Some golems continued to hobble around aggresively even after I took all their dry artifacts. The shifting planets sometimes make game areas too dark, and on some occassions after I put in a lot of time and effort to reach a very out of the way area I was rewarded with absolutely nothing. In some respects the game feels unfinished. An issue with many games these days that have pressure to be ready for release.

Would have liked more areas and more characters to interact with. Maybe a little more of an RPG aspect. Maybe a sequel will come out. I had a lot of fun with this. Well worth what I paid for it.
 
PRAEst76
731 produits enregistrés
0

Some mechanics were really cool though, mid-air wall building, grappling hook and zip-lines were fun. But the game got boring for me way too quickly. It's a good game, but It's not for me

7.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2017
I really enjoyed the start and especially the middle but I have to say the mechanics don't really build upon themselves very much with time. There is only so far you can go with dodging and grabbing the things off the enemy and that really shines in the final boss. There were a few bugs along the way, a few of which resulted in a fair bit of progress and XP being lost. The parkour mechanics are a little bit wonky and other 3D platformers certainly feel and control far better - A Story About My Uncle being a prime example. Still, this game is only 10 bucks at the time of writing so I'm still going to recommend this game because I do feel that I got my money's worth. I just hope some of the minor bugs will get resolved and that the final boss is removed/reworked to be more like something unique, and less like just another rock mini-boss.

Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2019
I decided to give this game a chance despite the recent negative reviews, as it was on sale and tagged with things I like. I have to say, I'm enjoying it quite a bit! The environments are interesting, the parkour elements are fun to play with, and I'm curious about the rest of the plot.

It does have its issues of course. I can only get it to run correctly in windowed mode at a much smaller resolution or the whole thing lags like crazy. And the voice acting is entertaining, to put it that way. But so far I'm enjoying the aesthetics and casual chill gameplay, so I'd say give it a try if you happen to see it on sale!

Recommandé
19.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2021
Смесь различных жанров при этом, почти все элементы сыроваты. Немного напоминает A Story About My Uncle, с поправкой на метроид.

Если разобрать на отдельные составляющие, то почти всё выполнено средне.
· сомнительный сюжет. Он вроде как есть, но вроде как и нету. Возможный "твист" концовки завязан на сбор секретов, поэтому быстро пробежавшие вообще не поймут, о чем была речь.
· корявые сражения, не очень понятно зачем их вообще добавили именно в таком виде, просто для разнообразия наверное.
· местами спорный левел-дизайн, из за которого часто не очень понятно куда можно забраться, а куда нельзя. Более того, особо настойчивые исследователи мира могут софтлокнуть себя, попав из-за глюков паркура (и неудачно сохранившись) в места из которых невозможно выбраться без способностей, открывающихся по сюжету. Мне например как минимум один раз пришлось использовать читы на левитацию чтобы уйти из зоны, из которой я не мог выбраться с текущими способностями.
· сама по себе графика конечно не выдающаяся, но в целом смотрится приятно. Некоторые жалуются на тормоза, но у меня всё было ровно.
· неплохой и достаточно удобный паркур
· поиск секретов сделан отлично. Есть неочевидные, есть сложные, а над некоторыми местами я прям надолго зависал.

По итогу - тут мне понравилась в первую очередь метроид-составляющая, которую игроки пробежавшие игру за 4-5 часов даже не увидели, лол! Реальное время прохождения ~12ч в быстром темпе (у меня ~16 т.к. играл вдвоем с женой), и у кого наиграно меньше по сути игру не прошли. Вобщем, за цену по скидке в 1$ однозначно рекомендуется не отбитым спидранерам, а обычным любителям жанра.
 
kogorash
338 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2016
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

As far as first-person platforming games go (Mirror's Edge, a Story About My Uncle, Valley, etc...) this is also a quality and enjoyable title in that genre. I would also reccomend this game to fans of the Prince of Persia series as the mechanics and aesthetic are very similar, but in a first person format. You can slide, wallrun, run up certain surfaces, etc, while collecting a variety of "orbs" / scattered throughout the large, open levels. A dash is added for the very limited "combat" which involves dodging distinct and very sparse enemy interactions. The level design of the deserted surroundings look great with vibrant colors and impressive vistas. The introductory tutorial sequence looks quite bland by comparison to how the game looks shortly following, so give it a chance.

Recommandé
7.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mai 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

First-person Puzzle Platforming
Noticed that not a lot of people have played this game (i.e. video or text walkthroughs and guides)
I want to be thorough with my review but I'll have to check back later if and when I can.
I am currently on the Fire level doing their gauntlet of "new ability" - making temporary platforms...it is heinous. Probably the biggest difficulty curve I've seen in a game. Just due to the fact there is little checkpoints. Right after you get the ability there is 1 checkpoint but 2 objectives...there should a handful of other checkpoints because just parkour challenging the way to the top of the mountain with these platforms in such close proximity is too much. It is easier for me to straight up kill myself than climb all the way through the dungeon to get back to the first platform (assuming I lived the fall).

    Pros:
  • Very pretty on the Unity 4
  • Story is simple
  • Characters are well voice-acted

    ♥♥♥♥:
  • Some glitching - stuck in walls due to incredulous momentum, falling a certain way makes you invincible to environmental hazards like lava and cacti
  • There are little checkpoints - so save frequent and often, use all your saved token-things...because you are going to hate losing them when you die. You may die a lot.
  • Sometimes the objectives are clearly layed out, it may be "just above" but likely also a few walls over and with no map you can get lost easily.
  • There was lots to look at, but the game was too spread out...and with minimal music it definitely had its eerie and quiet moments of just empty.

    I should only be around 1/3-1/2 completion thus far...and I'd say the game is punishing but fair. I'd recommend if you were into Mirror's Edge, Portal, creative exploration of Dying Light.
 
SunshinyJuzez

Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2017
I really wanted to like this game but I can't. the controls feel very clunky, my character feels slow, and there is no air control (or very little). I really don't like the voice acting. I can take low budget voice acting as long as it is kept to a minimum but they are always talking, and my character is always making grunting noises when jumping, reminiscent of quake only much more annoying.

Here is my account:

Ok let me see how this game works for me. Ok some jumping puzzles, ok I think I'm getting the hang of this. Man my character is sure talking allot and I hate it but its Ok its the beginning of the game this is fine, I'm sure hell shut up soon. Ok i'm in some kind of surrealist world where there are magical mcguffins everywhere. Ok I can get into it. Man its hard to figure out the significance of all of these things oh well I'm sure it will make sense in time. Hes still talking...

Oh cool an enemy with swishing lasers, I bet I have to navigate around it and not get caught in the ... oh the off switch is right there, ok that's fine its probably an example level that's ok I guess. Man are they still talking?

Oh no a big monster, better evade him since this is a par-core game and all..... still evading..... still evading. Ok what the heck am I supposed to be doing? Ok Ill let him hit me just for giggles. Ok his back is flashing, I'll.... hit 'E'? ok hes dead. well that was..... anticlimactic. whatever its supposed to be about the running and jumping.

Ok a level up....thing where I can spend my points.....what the heck are these options? better focus? um ok I guess Ill get that out of curiosity, and more health? I don't have a problem with health but ok, at least I know what that one does. ok a new area. NOW SOMEONE ELSE IS TALKING TO ME omg the dialogue is worse than the voice acting, errg, I cant skip this I can't jump and i'm moving really slow. Ok this is making me mad now.

Its over. ok there are some laser things again. Can't find the switch to turn them off. I'm caught in the beam... oh they just lightly pepper you with slow moving easy to dodge bullets that do little damage.......ok. what am I suposed to be doing here anyway? ok I'm at the top of the thing oh there is a collectable up here. But other than that this area is essentially a dead end. The whole laser climbing thing was just a dead end.

Ok whats this way? A big cliff over the ocean. "jump into the ocean to start your adventure" ..... um ok..... the ocean has been instant death this whole game but.... fine. "You passed the level" I click continue. I then immediately die in the ocean.......whhhhat? response back at the top, ok there is a little outcropping so maybe that way? Just. barley. make. it. Was I even supposed to make that? now I have to do what seems like a jumping puzzle in reverse. Am I supposed to be here?

I make it to some weird area full of yet more unexplained magical mcguffins. I click on one that says meditate.

Now I'm in a HUGE challenge course thing (I did not sigh up for this).... ok maybe this is where all the running is. I run for a little and go into a glowing thing. now I'm in another challenge course. challenge-course-seption? The challenge courses are nothing but frustratingly difficult with the still clucky controls. I want out, I hit escape, I don't see "exit challenge" (maybe it was there I just didn't see it) I see a quit. "are you sure you want to quit?". I hope they mean the challenge course. Nope the whole game...... find I'm done.

Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2017
9/10 Would recommend

This game is very enjoyable, I noticed a lot of people have complained about the optimization and while that may be an issue for some, I have had no issues so far. People also need to realize that only a small team of individuals are working on this title, so bugs and issues will occur. I will say one of the annoying things about the game, is the lack of a community surrounding it. I was trying to look for a walkthrough to get through a particularly difficult part and I couldn't find anything on it at all! I ended up finding a workaround using a ledge that I wasn't supposed to use, if the dev team reads this, I can tell them exactly how I did the workaround so they can patch it. So, all-in-all, I really enjoy this game I just wish it felt more linear at times.
 
G_Fyyar

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2021
I played almost an hour of Downward until reaching the meditation area, where you can practice the various parkour moves, including the ones you haven't unlocked yet. In this area, it quickly became obvious that the game's controls are not consistent and approachable enough to really make parkour work. Wallruns only sometimes work - often you jump off a wall too early because the game decided to, or you don't even stick to a wall. There is a grappling move that only sometimes works well and is a little strange and slow to use, especially in what is supposed to be fast parkour - you have to (at least it only seemed to work then) slow down time, then aim, then fire, and then fire again to grapple.

Ziplines have an extremely small hitbox, so you have to hit them dead on or fall. The camera was also a bit janky. While the story is kind of irrelevant in a game like this and the general explorable world showed premise at the beginning, I felt that the controls would only make the game frustrating later on, as some reviews seem to have pointed out already. Also it is clear early on that backtracking will be prevalent and the lack of a map makes it worse. If you get the game on a cheap sale of 50 % or more, it may still be worth checking out - maybe you can make it work a bit better, but there are better platforming games out there.
 
Yarusenai

Lucky for me, I stealed this pearl for less than 7 box.

Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

I purchased this game for ten dollars, and it was honestly worth it, and soon, hopefully, it'll be worth more. After only four and a half hours of gameplay, I completed all of the story up to this point, but I look forward in anticipation of future updates. There are lots of bugs glitches, and the "combat" takes some patience, but the parkour is gratifying and exciting and makes up for it in full. I am glad to support the developers and happy to know that Downward will be continued and improved in the future. I encourage readers who like Mirror's Edge to invest in the experience, but if you're looking for a challenging fight, steer clear until more information about the coming changes have reached your eyes and ears.

186 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2020
First off, do NOT buy this game if you care about good stories, lore, or anything like that. The story from beginning to end is abysmal. Absolute clown show. I never had a single clue as to what was going on aside from "there's some mystical objects and I need to get them." 2/10

The gameplay is pretty fun though. Decent parkour physics that can be a little buggy sometimes. There's a variety of different mechanics for getting around past just jumping and climbing which makes everything much more interesting as you unlock each one. The collectible system definitely seemed like it's there just to draw the game out past the really boring and quick story, but it was enough to keep me interested for a while. 7/10

The voice acting is really bad in most places and destroyed my immersion plenty of times, but it's forgivable at the end of the day. Other audio and sound design was great. 7/10

I'd recommend this game only because it's a neat little parkour game with some interesting mechanics. Nothing more.

Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Dieses Parkour Spiel vereint schönes Design mit gut funktionierendem Gameplay!

Nachdem ich es im Summersale gekauft habe, hab ich heute mal für ca. 30 Minuten reinschauen wollen. Daraus wurden schnell 3 Stunden. Teilweise sind die Grafikfilter etwas übertrieben und man sieht nichtmehr sofort alle Sprungpunkte in der Luft. Durch die Funktion sich einen Punkt zu setzen, zu dem man per Tastendruck zurück kommt, kann man vor schwierigen Passagen aber leicht Fehler ausbügeln ohne mit großen Problemen zu rechnen.

Auch für 9,99 sprech ich hier eine klare Kaufempfehlung aus, wenn einem das Design der Spielwelt und ein First Person Platformer ansprechen. Ich werds definitiv weiterspielen.

28.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

I'm absolutely in-love with this game!!! Now, you may say that I don't know what love is, but then I'd say, You don't know this excellent parkour game. ;) ...The ♥♥♥'s of this game - The story line is far from complete. It's a little buggy with some quite unexpected and sudden crashes. I had about 5 crashes in total; first crash at my 8 hour mark and the last 4 were just in the last few hours of the end of the game in it's current state of development. I took my time with the game and finished most accomplishments and items at around 16 hours total. This is all as of 3-4-17, so they may have these things ironed out quite quickly. I did my part and sent in ALL crash reports. *Shrugs... The Pro's - There's too many to mention, honestly, but I'll try and be short. Here goes! ---> Excellent ambiance, atmosphere, sounds, aesthetics, visually appealing, SMOOTH GAMEPLAY that IS NOT glitchy or sticky, game makes you want to look and touch everything for extremely close analysis, NEVER A BORING MOMENT, extremely interesting storylines so far with at least 3 separate conflicting characters (Who to listen to or trust?!), voice acting totally believable, and even with the crashes I had I was able to quickly access and continue my story from last save without all of that logo / intro crap and credits nonsense that makes games so slow to start... I want to see much more in this game with updates in the future AND want to see these developers from The Caracal Team do lots more with their gaming/ crafting skills!... I definitely would recommend this game to anyone that likes Stealth and Parkour style games. This game is most like Lemma to me and I think it has the air of The Myst Franchise. I'd most like to see this game expand on more playable alternate dimensions with world(s) attributes and combinations, unlocking even greater skills for more difficult challanges, and have each NPC characters affects alternative story endings with the paths we choose, for even greater replayablility.
 
Catpsyche
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 mars 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

This is the greatest game ive played in years!
This game is absolutely addicting and fantastically fun at the same time. I kind of enjoyed mirror's edge which is the only other game like this on the market and this outshines it by miles! This game takes a free running genre and combines it with an open world in a fantasy setting. Love it. But thats not even the greatest part of this game, puzzles. Literally every segment of this game is a puzzle and they are all very well crafted and put together in a non obvious way that has many paths to completion. When I hit the end of the developed part of this game (as its still in progress) I wanted more right away!
Another part of this game I absolutely love is that they don't take a linear approach to anything. There is a main storyline but you don't have to follow it for a long long time if you don't want to. Instead you can say no thank you to the voice in your head, go explore, find hidden treasure and fun obstacle courses, earn coins and buy upgrades, decorate your hideout, on and on and on!
My final thoughts here are for the developers on where they can take the rest of the 2/3rds of the game that has yet to be released.
I personally would really enjoy it if you keep up what i love about it so far (as stated above) but add in a few layers of psychological confusion. The wanderer hears a voice in his head so make it trick him/not be real/ make him doubt reality. The sheer level of mind games you can do with this storyline is astounding and I would really like to see something along those lines.
I would also really like to see the game develop more perks whether they be less fall damage scaling to no fall damage, or one perk you can level infinitely that increases your run speed by 1-5% per level purchased. I love the idea of a perk system and in a game with no combat you can really get creative on the things to offer the player.

Summary: Amazing graphics, great physics, amazing storyline, very addicting, recommending to everyone I know.
 
Karakken

It's a really fun experience. The story is quite mediocre, and half of the time you don't know what you're doing or where you're going (the objective marks are broken), but the world is beautiful and immersive, and traversing and exploring it is just fun.
There are a few ♥♥♥♥, the final boss battle is a royal pain, not really challenging nor difficult, but annoying as hell, and the challenges are completely redundant, and can be quite annoying as well if you care about the achievements. The overall fun factor tops all that though, and still makes it worth the time.

Non recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

This game was mediocre for what it offers. The parkour itself was okay, but games like mirror's edge did a better job at giving the feeling of speed and momentum when running in-game.

For the bad: the parkour sections are almost insultingly easy. What actually is insultingly easy is the "combat." The combat sections consists of circle strafing enemies and waiting for them to have an opening where you can disable them. The enemy attacks are slow and provide no challenge. At no point did I feel in danger of death or even really of being hit. The voice acting is poor, and the writing for the story is even worse. The main character was pretty annoying to me and sounded like the most generic person you can think of with really pointless dialogue.

In addition, the game is buggy. For example, at times in the game the camera will move automatically to "show" you objects that the game wants to highlight. This happened to me early in the game and the camera was stuck on the object even after I interacted with it. The only way to unlock my camera was to kill myself in the game. I also got stuck inside a ledge at one point.

With both the story and gameplay being this boring, I can only recommend this game to hardcore fans of parkour-like games. For the rest of us, I suggest avoiding this game.
 
Huey

Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Played around 2 hours to get the general feel of the game.

Pros:
-Beautiful graphics
-Responsive controls
-overall good gameplay
-performance friendly
-has a lot of graphics settings (I hope they will add a bloom toggle in the future)
-Challenges are really fun to play, and is perfect for the hardcore parkour gamer.
-Developers are really active and listen to the community, with a lot of weekly updates.
-music is decent

♥♥♥♥
-decent to terrible voice acting (main character should say less)
-doesnt really have a good story, but doesnt really aim for that either (at least not at my point in the game)
-sound design is a bit off at some point (character falls from 200 ft to his death and all he says is "oh")
-has a few bugs, but since its in beta, its more then understandable

What I would like to be improved:
- go a bit more rpg. if there were more quest and a bigger world to explore , this could become a really amazing game. mechanics are already solid, but a few more enemies would be nice (Again, im not that far into the story)
- workshop support and a level creator could keep this game playable for a long time
-remove/change some voice lines
-animate the characters mouths

Rating:
8/10.
I was pleasantly suprised that an indie game studio came out with such a solid title, but I was a bit worried the mechanics would be a bit clunky. that was not the case since the game is very responsive, and thats all I really asked for.

141 produits enregistrés
2
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
41.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

First thing that comes to mind about this game is the looks. It is beautiful. It feels awesome to move through the world and just look arround.

The world is open, but not very big. There is one short section where you will learn basics, one big main area arround the temple and (i assume) 3 separate areas connected with portals. There is only one for now, but i am pretty sure that two more are coming. Even though, the world is not huge, you will get the chance to play it in (once again i assume) 4 different settings, each time unlocking few more secrets.
There is also practise and challenge area. This is the wolrd you enter when you meditate. Area itself is simple and not interesting, but the challenges are very welcome. It is always nice to put the skills to the test.

As for the story, i can't really say much as it is far from complex or engaging. It will definately be interesting to see what happened to the world and the few characters that we meet, but i don't expect mind blowing twists or deep backgrounds. I don't even know who am i playing and why.
We might get to see two different endings depending on collecting certain items for certain "person". Some betrayal possibly... That is just my mind doing some random thinking :D
Anyway, the story exists and it's not crap.

And finally, the gameplay and the actual parkour. Well, hmm. The moves are there, walls, gaps, edges, but i just don't feel like i am doing that much. You can chain some serious moves only in the challenges. Not only that, but no skill is even needed through the story. You can pass the obstacle, stop and do the next one almost from standstill. Also, it is all done with one key (which is making it even worse since i can't chose between wallrun and walljump which results in ocasional fails) and timings are way too easy. Reaching the destination is not a matter of skill, but time.
Dash is fairly useless outside challenge.
One obvious contender in the genre is Mirror's edge, but lets not compare these games. The one game that i think should be compared is Deadcore. When i bought Downward, this is the style i expected. Combining multiple dashes with jumps and boost and double jumps, creating impressive moves and passing areas in different ways.Honing the skills and owning the leaderboards. When i reach the top i want to feel like the freeclimber filled with pride and excitement.

In summary, i enjoyed the game. Had a lot of fun with care free exploration of a beautiful world. Unfortunately, one of the selling points is actaully one of the worst aspects and that is the parkour. I will still highly recommend this game to every casual gamer and explorer.
 
Twisted Mind

SecondSplash
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
23.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2017
I quite liked the game. For a 7EUR price tag you can't expect much, but it absolutely gave me my money's worth.
While the game was short and relatively easy, it's so pretty. It's a wonderful visual experience throughout the entirety of it. I played this maxed out and the visuals reminds me of The Witness, but with modern graphic capabilities which is a very big plus from me. Pretty colours and environments envelop you constantly and gives you something nice to look at while exploring your way through this strange world.

The gameplay is a bit too basic for me however, literally just coming from Mirror's Edge speedrunning makes this feel very easy. You can get by with your spacebar and sloppy mousing almost everywhere. Where you can't, the "Focus" ability just bails you out since you'll never run out of it, ever. The mechanic of creating blocks and jumping on them is very blunt too. Doing them in a fast succession simply doesn't work, it won't respond and you'll fall to your death so the gameplay slows down using them.

I did find some challenge in the meditating area however. The fact that you can combine dashing to wallruns means you can move through areas much quicker, and made the game oh so much more difficult when you were on a clock and trying to min/max. I feel that's where the game took the same turn as Mirror's Edge: Catalyst did: The whole concept of parkour is literally "gotta go fast" but when you have so much to collect around you, you never end up going fast. That's where the meditating area came into play and gave me some enjoyment in difficult gameplay.

The skills are also pretty pointless, I got by the final parts of the game with one HP upgrade. Nothing is necessary. I never ran out of anything, and especially due to "The Mark" being sort of a broken mechanic. You can get away with anything as long you're quick enough to teleport back before you die. I hoped this mechanic would bring for some interesting gameplay puzzle wise. This could have easily been a much more complex game if you simply added in the fact that you'd be able to change planets and keep your marks. Make the mark a necessity in the gameplay being able to get places different planets don't let you.


That said, I still enjoyed the game enough to go and finish and try to find all the endings. It's a very cheap game so you can't set the standards too high. It does a few things really well, and those things were worth the price to me. Just the visuals alone were.

I won't comment on the story, or bugs since I'm aware this game just got released and will undergo some changes. The story simply because I'm not sure I've seen all there is to see yet. (As of now the story is quite wonky to me).

It's still an awesome job for a 3 person team to make a game of this magnitude, while there's fixes to made and things that could be better I still think the game deserves some credit.
 
yung
66 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2018
I am underwhelmed by the storyline of this game. It seemed so very promising at first but maybe I'm misunderstanding something somewhere. A dramatic backstory at the beginning of the game and a more wholesome ending probably would have made it make more sense. Otherwise, if you have fun being thrust into a limited, confusing yet gorgeous wasteland with bugs and glitches threatening to ruin your progress, strange physics that aren't part of the game's motif (Compare the character falling 500 feet into water without submerging or, hell, dying on impact versus floating rocks influenced by shifting gravitational fields- the former is a design problem), and abrupt endings that leave you feeling unsatisfied, then have at it.
The game was still fun for a parkour game. The environments were incredible and awe inspiring. I would have enjoyed it more if I understood what I was looking at (hence why I wish there was a background given at the start of the game) but I enjoyed the visuals nonetheless. BEWARE: follow the objectives and avoid visiting places out of order. This game plays as an open-world but has a singular, objective-based story line. I learned the hard way that if you visit an area before the game makes it your objective, it'll glitch. For example, I discovered the second-to-last level around the beginning and after completing the tasks to accomplish the overall objective of that area (I'm being vague because I'm still recomending the game) the game wouldn't progress further and I had to delete my progress and start all over.
In sum, it was a great idea for a game, but it was executed poorly. I've seen worse, sure, but this was just disappointing for me. Great controls, confusing storyline and the whole time you're flirting with glitches. Play it for the parkour and pray that the studio remasters it with a complete story. More time and money on the developers' side would have made a world of difference. 2.7 out of 5.0 stars.
 
cheezeberga

5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 février 2018
Downward è un gioco ♥♥♥ molto potenziale e ♥♥♥ alcuni aspetti positivi, ma complessivamente non me la sento di consigliarlo.
L'ottimizzazione altalenante, la trama abbastanza inconsistente, il sistema di combattimento fin troppo semplice e poco soddisfaccente rovinano l'esperienza di gioco, rendendo il titolo inconsistente. Ci sono tante cose da fare, ma tutto sommato si tratta per lo più di raccogliere collezionabili e delle pietre utili per aprire vari portali nel mondo di gioco.

L'elemento più importante di questo gioco dovrebbe essere il park-our, che però risulta abbastanza debole, troppo macchinosa e vincolata.

Lo consiglio per l'atmosfera particolare e sicuramente ben curata, nonché per il doppiaggio dei The Pruld, che mi ha strappato qualche sorriso. Meritano anche una menzione le musiche, abbastanza carine.

Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2016
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Ho incontrato gli sviluppatori al GamesWeek 2016 e questo gioco mi aveva particolarmente incuiriosito, ora che ho giocato completamente alpha posso dare una mia prima impressione:

La mappa è disseminata di muri, colonne ecc.. che permettono al giocatore di fare parkour. Ci sono anche dei collezionabili che andranno venduti per potenziare il nostro personaggio ♥♥♥ un albero delle abilità.

Molto carina idea di un area "training" dove il giocatore può allenarsi facendo parkour in libertà.

Graficamente mi ha colpito positivamente, molte volte mi sono fermato a osservare il paesaggio, Un unreal engine 4 usato molto bene.

I comandi sono abbastanza reattivi non ho mai avuto problemi ♥♥♥ essi (giocato ♥♥♥ tastiera e mouse, col controller non so).

Per concludere consiglierei il gioco sia a chi è nuovo nel ambito del Parkour sia ai più esperti perchè a mio parere merità molto.
 
RaheartH

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
14.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 juin 2019
Downward is an open-world parkour game and there is only a handful of games with parkour elements out there. It's not the best parkour game and sometimes it's glitchy, but overall it offers a parkour experience in a fantasy-like-way.

Keep in mind that this game is made in Unreal Engine so it can be very resource hungry at high setting. The world looks stunning and ready to be explored, but there are also enemies out there to keep you a little on edge which leads to the combat system in this game:

Well, the combat system is pretty much barebones to say the least. You won't get any weapons or need to use melee combat. Yes, there is a skill tree, but it's mostly for boosting your stats points. Just expect to evade a lot of attacks. Besides that it is all about collecting stuff and figuring out how to get to the next quest.

There are also parkour challenges if you want to do something else then exploring. Those are pretty entertaining if you like speedruns.

So overall if you're hungry for a parkour game in this setting why don't give it a try?
 
CCL sama

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
12.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2018
It's like a more fun & better version of Mirriors Edge. It has it's issues and bugs. It's not all that polished but if you're looking for a really fun & unique parkour game, then Downward is definitely worth a go.

There's a demo you can even try as well.

I enjoyed it from start to finish & had very minor frustrations. The openess of the game was great as well, it's open world and the areas are massive although at a glance they might look small, the developers did really well to utilise the space both horizontally and vertically. So there's a lot explore.

I liked the combination of fantasy & parkour. The voice acting was a little off here and there but the story was actually pretty interesting.

The visuals are absolutely gorgeous, even in the volcanic areas that are dark and pretty consist of ash & lava

The game took me around 12 hours to complete and that's without fussing over the collectables. I loved it.

0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 février 2018
I'm new to the first-person Parkour game scene, but I thought this title looked gorgeous so I had to pick it up.

I remember playing Dying Light, and thinking that whoever decided to put the jump button on a trigger was a freaking idiot, and apparently the developers here had the same bright idea. They did also have enough foresight to make an Xbox controller remappable in the options. Thank God.

I did so, my only complaint is that the tutorials are not affected by the remapping, so even if you remap the controls before beginning the title, the tutorials instruct the player to use the original keys. This is easily overlooked after you begin playing and have developed your own rhythm. I switched the jump key to the A button like a sane person and all is forgiven. ( honestly I ended up remapping most of the buttons because of what I felt where I had choices, but that's not really an issue, I did find it odd that the d-pad was disabled in the button configurations, it would have been useful)

Outside is that the game is pure vertigo-inducing fun.

Overall, great game, I look forward to doing a lot of jumping.

Get Super Cloudbuilt instead. The parkour mechanics are so much better and even though its not open world its somehow more fun to explore, as well as having stuff to explore and incentives to do so.

Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2017
I want to like this game I really really do the running around is amazing the world design is fantastic. I liek thre parkour moves and the story it all seems to make a grteat package but there are3 things that are keeping me from giving it a positive review

Optimization.
This game taxes my CPU and GPU more then any other game Ive ever played, im playing at medium graphics and its still stuttering and overheating sometimes and I have more then the recoomended specs.

Lighting
Playing with everything at medium and I cant see ANYTHING in the dark, when im in the underground cavern place ( with the merchant) i litearlly cant see where im going or anything around me, even when i move the brightness up to 2 I can barely make things out. THis part makes the game unplayable for me if I cant see where I am going

Graphics settings

Why are some setting locked at medium and high I cant turn some options off, with the current performance and optimization issues this needs to be addressed in my opinion.

I will be playing this game still and checking back, and the moment I see these issues addresed (especially the lighting one) I will change this review to a positive as it is a good game

Recommandé
8.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2020
Beat it in 5 hours with mild side-exploration. This isn't the best First Person Parkour game ever, but it's alright. Parkour isn't free exploration so much as it is "hold space while moving at this texture, you'll do a specific move," which has the benefit of making the game much less about execution and precision and more about exploration. You'll never wonder "how the hell do I make that jump," but rather, "which way do I go to make progress up towards that ledge?"

Combat is... nonexistent at best, a brief pause in exploration at worst. All bosses except the last one are technically optional, and fighting them is... well, your moves are "jump," "move out of the way," and "collect items," and the fights use all of those.

The game is *very* dark, and brightness/gamma are in Advanced Options under graphics. The game is rather pretty, and sets a very desolate, uniquely apocalyptic tone. In short, worth about $20.
 
Extramrdo
630 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2021
This is Prince of Persia with less focus on combat and a slightly more surreal environment. A little jank, but terribly good fun, no game-threatening issues. Pretty, interesting, engaging. Maybe twelve hours of serious play long, with more content beyond the beginning to end storyline.

While it's not easy, it doesn't punish you for failure, which is a nice change of pace. Controls feel a little odd but you can get used to them pretty easily.

Leaderboards for the obstacle courses/races are all full of 0.000 times. Mild downside, but I don't assume I'm going to be there myself.

Overall, I'd give it a solid 9.8/10. I wish I'd bought it earlier, especially for how much it goes on sale for.
 
Smallest Kaiju

I liked the game very much. I'm quite into these parcours games like "The Valley" or "Mirrors Edge". This one was a little tricky because you can alter the world by switching the water or lava level.
But I found enough of the collectibles needed to enable all three endings. It took me 13 hours to complete the game, and I did see all areas of the game. Some collectibles are hidden on roofs, towers or behind rocks. But you don't need them all to unlock the third secret ending.
For 3 Euros it was absolutely worth it.

411 produits enregistrés
