Dread Baron Beardly
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juillet 2017
First of all this game looks, sounds and plays very well, imo and i'm baffled to see so many negative reviews. The devs are quite active on the forums and reply to nearly everyone that gives them feedback. Also here on the page are patch notes for anything they've done and plan on doing in the future, in regards to fixing and updating this game.
So yeah i don't see what many are on about here, especially if we consider the games price..


Voice, Characters and Sound:

I think the VO is spot on, across the board good actors, sound quality and the humor of the main character, compared to what i've seen from the early access version, is also pretty funny and likable. The other characters VO i came across are on par as well, imo

The atmospheric sounds are very well done, what is lacking is music and certain actions from the mc doesn't seem to make any sound, sometimes.


Story:

it is all very vague at the beginning, but i get the feeling that one or the other characters are not what they seem to be..
They hint quite a bit, but i won't spoil what i think about characters and story at this point.

Gameplay:

This game would best be described as a first person 3D platforming game with exploration
and metroidvania elements. Mechanics get upgraded as you do the story and there are also orbs which are used to upgrade skills. For erxample a doublejump ability on anomalies, a slingshot to other anomalies and so on.
The fact that you loose these orbs as you die seems a contention point in the reviews here, but they respawn pretty often so, i see where many are coming from, but honestly you need to backtrack a quite a bit in this game, you might as well get new orbs as you do that.

Also the challenges are extremly clever and require a fair bit of skill, this makes the game very replayable, even if you are finished with the main story.

Tip:

You do not need the focus to use grappling or platforms. This was a thing that bothered me, but the dev team explained to me that it was indeed not nesscery to focus to use these abilities.


FYI:

If you have problems with motion sickness, you might wanna try the demo first.
The combat and dashing has quite a bit of head bobbing and even i, someone that does not have problems with it normally got a bit dizzy after my first play session.


Performance:

Here lies my biggest complaint about the game so far.
I would even go as far as to say there is no optimization in this game at certain spots at this time.
An example would be the second statue you come across to upgrade skills.
If you turn around to a water spot where you came from the fps drops down to 45, that was the case in all presets i tested and i tested it multiple times, around all of the gameworld.

I did put it back on ultra as i didn't saw any reason not to.
With a gtx 970, 16 Gig RAM, Intel Xeon Cpu and Win 10 Pro 64 bit i should be able to run this thing at 60 fps in 1080p, the world is not that big and all other games get stable, eventually, so.. yeah.

Edit: After the update today it seems like i gained four to five frames in certain spots, but the game is still extremly hardware hungry and needs futher optimization overall.
 
Bazzy

96 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
9.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 février 2019
I beat the game and had some fun, but this is too poorly made to justify the investment of time.

Whoever was in charge of level design bashed any hope it had, let alone the awkward controls.

First, the good -

Platforming can be fun at times, but awkward.

Graphically pleasing.

That's it.

I'll try to break down the bad -

THE GAME'S NAME IS CRUELLY IRONIC, AS IT'S THE WORST PART OF IT; pretty much you progress through the game and are often challenged with platforming higher and higher to reach a very high point. You finish that objective, and now you have to go all the way down the way you came. It can be very difficult at times and you'd think falling down to your death would spawn you at the bottom (dying penalizes your currency), but no. You spawn back at your last save point or the point of your last objective.

The controls are weird and climbing ledges can easily glitch out.

The dash feels worthless and it is very hard to fully dodge away from drones before they explode (almost making the last boss impossible without health and damage reduction upgrades). The dash's only purpose in the entire game seems to be getting away from drones exploding or awkwardly speeding up your long runs.

The dash may be the funnest part of the game actually, because you can easily make it glitch out while leaving a ledge and keep its momentum to shoot you off very fast. This is most useful when you can land in the water below, as you are likely to face death without that.

The upgrade system is crap.

Losing currency upon dying is terrible. Why do enemies respawn and turrets after you hit their "totem" to deactivate them? It adds this really weird grindy feel to the game when you should be pushing forward.

The save system doesn't properly work; you won't be in the same spot as you last saved, at the same objective, or have the same items or amount of currency.

The golems are boring to fight and random. Entering and leaving their "aggro" zone triggers their music and and soon as you leave the border of that zone, it turns off lol.

WTF is going on with the story? Seriously, wtf was that?! WHAT WAS IT?!?!?! WHAT THE HELL WAS THAT LAVA TURTLE AND WHAT WAS THE ENDING? NOTHING IS EXPLAINED AT ALL IN THIS GAME AND IT MAKES PRACTICALLY ZERO SENSE.

In the tutorial section, why isn't the merchant made obvious where he's at? I maxed the currency upgrade first, so it wasn't a problem in the game, but seriously. I never sold a single item I collected to the merchant.

It is very easy to get lost at times and without watching a Youtube playthrough of the game, I would not have been able to finish this. The 4 different planes you can eventually exist in are not hinted at when you need to be in them.

Seriously. Let's talk about the section where you have to open the three gates towards the end while in the three different "planes". If you choose a plane where the water levels have risen and you fall in the water, you are unable to get back onto the center island easily like you can in any other plane; you are forced to take the SINGLE LINEAR path, which takes a lot of platforming, just to get up on the the high rising platform with the chain to slide back to the island and change what plane you're on.


SUMMARY -

This game makes me upset, but it was cheap. I kept hoping for the game to really pick up, all the while realizing its flaws. The game made me angry because it trolled me into a couple hours of gameplay that I felt compelled to finish it so I would never have the desire to play it again.

You will find yourself often lost, back tracking, wondering wtf the story is up to, and most of the time not having fun.

Only play this if you are hardcore about the FPS platforming genre, but please stick to Refunct, A Story About My Uncle, Clustertruck, or Jumps if you haven't played those.
 
Ching Chao

The game plays like a cross between Mirror's Edge and Prince of Persia Sands of Time. Beautiful to look at, yet often difficult to know where you are supposed to go and how to get there. New skills learned on the way help the exploration and just when you think you have the hang of it, you can flick a switch to cause the gravity to go bonkers... This game is great fun... I have no idea what I'm doing, but I am having great fun experimenting !

3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2020
This is a compelling and competent 3D platformer. The controls are crisp, and the parkour is difficult, but manageable. The learning curve is well thought out, and the environments are beautiful. Only downside is "combat". While mechanical enemies have an Off-switch somewhere in the level, golems need to be deactivated, on a certain animation. until then, dodging their attacks isn't very well implemented. The levels are very open and reward exploring every time. Didn't finish the game, because I suck at 3D platformers, but even I could enjoy what is there. Absolute steal for the price!

Follow my curator at https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/

this is the biggest waste of money ive ever spent on a video game. there are no instructions, about how to play, what to do, where to go, nothing. they give you a compass and say figure it out yourselves. the game is so dark that they include a native artificial screen brightener. maybe next time dont make 3/4 of the game pitch black? the worst part is that there is no way to die in some parts of the game. that might sound great, but when you have to quit the game because youre trapped in water and cant move, then youll realize that losing the last half hour of work isnt the most fun thing ever. i bought this thinking that it would be a cool puzzle-ish game like a story about my uncle, but it ended up being the worst playing experience ever

4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2017
I got this game on sale for 6.50 and it was worth it. the core gameplay feels good and the platforming is fun and intuitive. the world design is nice also. the voice acting is of the same calliber as most indie games so its not particularly horrible to me. the story is so bland and vague that it might as well not be part of the game but the story isnt the focus so its fine. the combat is abysmall but besides the last boss you can ignore combat for the most part. I had a lot of trouble getting this game to run at 60 fps. I have a gtx 970 and a quad core 3.2 ghz i5 so i didnt expect problems running this game but i had to lower graphics settings and even then sometimes the game would glitch and cap at 30 fps even though i set it to 60. over all if you can focus on the core gameplay and view this game as a series of platforming levels and just ignore the story and combat. youve got a good 4-6 hours of a game here
 
cheezbass
313 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juillet 2017
[First impressions - Played for about 30 minutes]

Downward has some great platforming gameplay and gorgeous graphics, but it suffers from a lack of polish that can be frustrating at times.

Sound-wise, the game needs improvement. The VA is passable, definitely, and the music fits, but there are actions that have no sound effects (for example wallrunning makes no sound) and it feels like they should - the game sounds like your protagonist is in a vacuum as the only sound effects you hear most of the time are the character's grunts as he runs and climbs.

Gameplay-wise the parkour so far is very good - the level design usually makes the various paths clear and there is a good sense of flow - you rarely need to stop to reorient yourself, you can usually just keep moving. The enemies do have a few attacks that are difficult to see coming or avoid, which I found frustrating.

Graphics-wise, the game looks gorgeous, with very good use of lighting and effects. In the game you get to see various alternate versions of the same area, and the devs have used lighting and colour really effectively to differentiate between the different versions of the same place. Unfortunately the game lacks graphical optimisation, and it struggled to run smoothly on my PC which usually has no issue with AAA titles. I had to turn down some of the settings, but even after doing that the game was only able to maintain 50 - 55 fps and not a smooth 60. I think the action in this game would look incredible at a fluid 60 fps so hopefully the devs are still working on optimisation.

In its current state I'd recommend this game only if you're a fan of first-person parkour games such as Mirror's Edge, or a fan of third-person platformers like Prince of Persia - but you MUST be very forgiving when it comes to the level of polish that can be expected in an indie game. For everyone else, I think it's best to give the devs a bit more time to smooth out the issues.
 
Chet_Awesomelad
864 produits enregistrés

Non recommandé
0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mai 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

Interesting premise and the art design is nice, but the overall makeup of the game has some major flaws.
They don't have a good information/mystery balance, so there's tons of teminology dumped onto the player before you even know the controls. The movement is trying to hard to feel smooth that it's vey unresponsive, and even in the tutorial level you get penalised for falls that aren't the player's problem but the fault of slow movement mechanics. The camera, on the other hand, moves way too fast and jerky, so that when you're moving you just have to guess whether you're doing the right thing. Also falls prey to the problem of trying to platform when you can't see your feet.
Also, the game has a really stong "Made in UE4" vibe that the devs haven't tried to overcome.
Probably would be okay for someone who could put up with this, but I'd rather play something with a little more nuance in the design.

Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2018
Questo gioco si presenta ♥♥♥ delle meccaniche di parkour ben strutturate, peccato che alla fine queste meccaniche risultino essere limitate non consentendoti di poterle sfruttare su tutte le superfici a tua disposizione e in certi casi costringerti ad utilizzare una certa abilità nel parkour piuttosto che un'altra. I nemici risultano essere troppo ripetitivi, specialmente i golem che anche se da livello a livello cambiano aspetto tutti quanti alla fine fallo le stesse cose. Il doppiaggio italiano, anche se è stato fatto dai ragazzi di ThePrudle, comunque non mi è piaciuto. Il doppiaggio mi sembrava troppo sul lato comico e non si intonava bene ♥♥♥ l'andamento del gioco, sarebbe stato meglio un doppiaggio ♥♥♥ una voce un pò più seria. La trama era molto semplice e scontata, ma alla fine non era un grosso problema.
Conclusione, da 1 a 10 io do un 5, purtroppo al di la della trama, il problema principale del gioco sono le meccaniche troppo limitate per il fatto che non è reso possibile sfruttare le meccaniche di parkour su tutte le superfici e non è data la possibilità di poter sfruttare le meccaniche a libero piacimento neanche il semplice fatto di potersi appendere su qualsiasi ciglio di una sporgenza anche la dove fosse stato possibile.

P.S. forse gli unici doppiaggi decenti sono stati l'anziano che incontravi ogni tanto nei vari livelli, il teschio che ti chiedeva di trovare le sue ossa e la tartaruga gigante
 
Shauni
130 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2019
For a small team (and a lot of bigger teams should take note!), this game is fantastic. Great puzzles, great reuse of the areas in different ways. Very nice looking environments and engaging sounds. The vertical nature of the game kept my palms sweaty through the whole game. By the time I had completed most of the areas, I was feeling pretty cool bouncing around and wall running.

I found the puzzles quite fun, most werent too challenging, but I did have trouble with a few being not so clear or intuitive. A nice touch that a lot of puzzle games lack, is a guide. Pressing Q in the game gives you a direction and a rough idea of where you need to get to next (for those negative reviewers that seemed lost when the game started). I got misled a few times by the markers, but thats part of getting to know the world.

I also really like a game that has decent tutorials and makes clear how to use different mechanics. Downward did a pretty good job of this with their ingame mini videos.

Negatives: It has a few bugs - fall death doesnt always kill, leaving the player in an odd state. Placing marks doesnt always work, and trying to recall to them doesnt either. They are also arbitrarily removed (as the game needs I guess). Triggering platforms etc that require focus dont always work either, resulting in many fall deaths because the recall also doesnt work. The AI is fairly basic, but understandable with a small team.

TLDR: Get the game, its great fun, but expect a not-fun ending...

**** Some Spoilers Below Re The Ending****




Unfortunately, the ending sssssuuuucccckkkkksss. I have now finished it, but it was a royal PITA. Placing marks and recalling is half nullified for the battle, making a core mechanic of the game nearly useless for the ending. With very limited options available when someone is shooting constantly at you, you can only strafe, or rush them. Rushing is terrible because as you get closer, they shoot faster at you. By the third waves death, you have to try and reach them on platforms / up high, as well as them teleporting around (just to rub it in that we cant to good effect).
THE WORST: Oh, and there is no save point just before the final battle, so you have to climb up the friggin bloody area over and over if you quit the game and want to re-attempt. I climbed up there a bunch while exploring, and now have to go back up there each time I want to retry the ending. GRRRRRR
 
Byron1c

The visuals are incredible expecially if you think that are made by only 3 people. The story and the combat are ok, even if they are not the strong point of the game they do their job.

Generally all the mechanics are made for experienced players, so i get why some of people don't get it, You must be old like me to appreaciate Downward in every aspect I suppose.

Ryski
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juillet 2017
Story
Centering around some abandoned ruins, Downwards story begins with the unnamed protagonist getting contacted by a mysterious voice. While you are at first hostile to the unknown entity, that animosity is overwritten with a rushed sense of trust due to the need to move the plot forward. Soon after, you help the entity by gathering 3 artifacts to place back on the Altar and this forms the most formulaic part of the narrative.

From here, you reach the location housing the artifact (usually in its own isolated area), converse with a mysterious old man that tells you a little about the past civilization of that particular location, and return the artifact back to the altar before repeating that 3-step process 2 more times.

That forms the bulk of the journey and during this time, the story gets very little development. Downwards wastes the potential to at least tell a interesting tale about the past civilization, instead opting to give the player pretty vague and bite sized pieces of information through the old man’s exposition.

Speaking of, the old man himself also showcases the game’s poor narrative. It’s made clear early on that it’s strange for frail old man to be in the abandoned ruins but no time alongside the main plot is spent on trying to flush out both his identity and his origin. Instead we’re just expected to treat him being here as a given.

Since these mysteries are really the only thing to latch on to in terms of a narrative for Downwards, the piecemeal way in which they are distributed will likely cause many to lose interest in both the plot and its handful of characters.

Gameplay
Downward is an open world first person parkour game. The map is designed as an open world but it consists of self-contained parkour sections, some of which are optional but most of which you’ll go through over the course of the main plot. The objective is then to get to the finish line and in this game that would be the artifacts you’re looking for.

In terms of movement, while you do have the standard move sets like wall running, wall jumping and wall climbing, you don’t get to choose where and when you can do them. These moves instead depend on the color of the wall right in front of you. Blues are for jumping, reds for climbing and oranges for running.

By forcing these interactions and having usually only one way to finish a parkour section, the game takes out any semblance of player choice, something I find completely perplexing given its genre. It tries to spice things up by progressively introducing 3 special moves along with the main story, that being a double jump, a slingshot maneuver and the ability to create platforms. However, these special moves can only be done when you’re in certain areas of the map since you need to be interacting with anomalies (strange balls of light) placed in the area. In doing it this way, it doesn’t address the whole issue of no player choice that comes with such a linear design.

Downward is going for a more platform feel. Many of its parkour areas involve taking 2-3 moves before landing on a spot and checking your bearings. Areas a more slow and methodical than fast-paced and how much you enjoy this style of play depends on your preference in pacing. Personally, I’d much rather the reliance on fast reflexes but your mileage may vary. The game also introduces a mini checkpoint mechanic called the Mark. It is essentially a checkpoint you can teleport to at any time in case you fall from great heights but other than the general parkour / platforming, the game also features overly simple combat.

I say overly simple for 2 reasons. Firstly, there are only 2 enemies and secondly, both fights have so little depth. One enemy explodes if you get too near it (so just dash away from it to trigger the bomb) and the other enemy can be defeated if you wait for it to do a particular attack. None of these incorporate any of the verticality or level design that comes with the general parkour section of the game. It is literally, walk around the enemy until they do the attack that makes them vulnerable.

With very little satisfaction from both combat and general parkour, there is no incentive to partake in the optional obstacle areas even if they do reward you with in-game currency that you’ll use to unlock the progression tree. This is also because the progression tree doesn’t give you anything that will substantially change your playstyle (it’s all just add health, reduce damage, etc).

Pros
1) decent visuals – expected for a UE4 game

♥♥♥♥
1) Scripted level design – no player choice to experiment around
2) Lack of any substance in the narrative – plenty of cryptic mysteries with not much else
3) Sound effects that lack impact – the player rarely makes thuds on the ground when he’s jumping in succession. It’s often quite silent making it really jarring when you know you’re jumping on concrete after concrete (nitpick)

Conclusion
Downward is a game that feels like it’s trying too hard to do too many things at once and as a result, it fails to go beyond simple mechanics. From the running, to its combat and there is little unique about this title that’s well executed enough to provide a compelling value. I would only recommend picking it up at 5 dollars.

Edit: Originally i had made a wrong assessment on the platforming elements of the game. I was unaware that it was trying to be a parkour platfomer and have since adjusted my review. I'm sorry for anyone that was potentially confused or misled due to my inaccuracy
 
Garbage
466 produits enregistrés
3
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juillet 2017
First of all, 9/10 is my honest rating. And here's why : Great graphics, nice lighting especially the sunrays, great level design, all landscape is realistic and feels natural, the ruins and buildings fit into each scene and blend well with the theme, they dont contrast enough to instantly catch your eye but are noticeable when looking for a route to your objective. nicely placed wooden planks and patterned walls to show a sence of direction to follow. plenty of hidden items and artifacts to find hiding around in corners. when a path ends then mechanics are usually required to advance. some of these mechanics require looking for to see but are never hidden. The mechanics work well with the flow of the gameplay and help to give the parkour some variety like double jump anomalies and star-like grab things --?
The enemies are slightly annoying but you can easily dodge them like running away from the golems or dashing away from an exploding drone. the turrets are a nice change because they require you to stay out their line of sight and search around for the deactivation totem.
Collecting the orbs is a nice side-objective to keep track of so you can level up you different skills.

I encountered some minor bugs like when knocking over some bricks and jumping sent me through the ceiling and climbing up onto the roof, out of the map. no way back apart from quitting to menu then restarting at the save-bell. not a big problem but was quite annoying when it happened. also other minor bugs like clipping through a summoned block, sliding through a gap in a rock to fall out the map completely, and mainly other little things like them that probably wont happen to you. something that I didnt really get along with was the control of the character, I was running good, stable FPS but the movement sometimes felt a bit unresponsive and slippy.

Most of these problems i can put behind me and not let them interrupt a great experience.
The reason i rated a 9/10 not 10/10 is because, yes there were some new mechanics like placing blocks, double jump, changing planets and sea level, but not enough time to explore them. The game felt quite short, and cramming all of those mechanics into (my) 6 hour experience felt quite rushed, and there wasnt much time to get to know each of them before you were introduced to the next one.

I wish there was a bigger community to it too. anyone got a WR for speedrunning this?

Overall, i recommend this game to anyone who likes parkour games, discovering ancient ruins or first-person adventure.

Laudrac
3,160 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 janvier 2017
Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

This game has really good potential.

The Good:
- Looks good
- Nice Price
- The world design is nice!
- Decent level system (pretty basic but still nice for a parkour game)

The things that really need improvement:
*****EDIT***** After doing the gold medals on challenges, I noticed that the Front Dash (shift + w) isn't even straight! It goes like 2 degrees left of where your crossair is at! I really don't understand how something like that could even be accetpable/undetected by the devs... *****EDIT*****
- motion blur still happens even when the setting is at 0. (Motion blur is terrible in every game where movement/aim precision is important)
- Needs more air control
- Many bugs when trying to wall jump where the character tries to climb (on blue and yellow walls) instead of jumping normally
- The challenge (i think it's number 6) with chains has bugged chains that make you go backwards when you jump.
- Remove the mouse movement lock during wall jumps
- The "climbing up a ledge" animation is so long it gets old really fast and becomes annoying after the first ledges
- Character making grunts and noises almost every jump gets old really quick.

Other points:
- Voice acting was really emotionless (bad) during the beginning but over time it seems the voice actors are more into it.
- I got my game soft locked trying to activate the machine with 4 planets on it (it was my quest objective at the time) and lost 10 minutes. Only happened once though.
- Would like to see more precise mouse sensitivity settings so fps players don't have to "get used" to their normal sensitivity everytime they stop playing this game.

With this pricing and some improvements, this game could easily become a must buy for any fan of parkour. I just hope this is not going to be yet another abandonned early access game.

goomingiswhattodo
0
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
11.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 juillet 2017
The game starts off in a basic manner, teaching you parkore 1 on 1, and helps you feel comfortable with the controls as you move along. You even earn a way to 'quick save' wherever you want in case you mess up, so you can quick key back to that spot. And the first hour or two are intersting enough, keeping your interest and enjoyment for a good chunk of the game.

So why don't I recommend this? I'll give a few reasons.

1) The game ATTEMPTS to give you a sandbox zone in which you can practice all the different mechanisms found within the game, and rewards you if you beat certain milestones within premade challenges. ATTEMPTS, because these challenges in no way match up to the actual requirements within the game, are way too difficult past the first few, and are not worth you time, since you can just as quickly gather the resources necesary to upgrade your stats.

2) Too dramatic of an upscale on the difficulty throughout the game. As I said, it progresses in difficulty, but just wait till you get to some of the later stages. You will literally spend at least half an hour trying to figure out where to go at some points, since you can't see anything. If you manage to find wherever that may be, you are then faced with the incredibly difficult task of GETTING PAST IT. Forget button mashing, that doesn't work here. In a spot where you have to do five things PER ACTION, and there are at least one or two things PER SECOND, and you have to keep this up for at least fifteen seconds of motion and action to get past a certain section of parkore. That is, if you don't mess up. One small mistake?? You'll be grinding that 'small' obstacle for the next half an hour.

Get past that headache?? Congrats!!! There's another one like it later up. These challenges become more and more annoying once you reach at least about halfway though the game.

3) A BIG ONE HERE. The game glitches. Bad. Sometimes you can't jump, can't dash, can't use your mouse - all of these still work out of the game by the way. It's just the game. I even literally got stuck in a wall once, and had to reload an old save to move on. From my experience playing through the game, be prepared for 2-3 extremely annoying glitches per hour, that you will have to reload an old save/ reset the game/ hope it fixes itself to move on.

and 4) The final boss is way too difficult, and is not scaled to AT ALL!!! You go from essentially facing mini easy bosses, to the ultimate GOD MODE boss without any warning, and keep dying. Over, and over, and over again.

This game does have some of its merrits. But for the headache - to - enjoyment ratio, unless you enjoy having an increasing feeling of frustration and annoyance - that only deepens as the game goes on - I DO NOT recommend this game. At least not without a lot of relaxing stress relievers throughout.
 
awesomeandrew169
3
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
8.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2018
This is the most beautiful broken game I have ever seen.

And omfg is it broken.Want to walk backward? Sorry, nope. No matter what key you use you won't go back (on my game at least). Those blue double jump things? Same as the grappling hook ones. Nearly inviable. I felt like I was playing Assassins Creed, because every time I had to take a leap of faith and hope I was looking in the right direction of the double jump or grappling. Cuz f*ck you if you can see them. Challenge to practice? Suuuure. First, make your way up the gdm wall for 15min to do a challenge for 1h trying to get silver at least! Why 1h? Because they don't explain how to use anything in the challenge? First time ziplining? How the hell do you let go. Jumping? How do you make a dash jump? Well, all they tell you is DASH, great help there...

This game feels like a unfinished indie 24h competition game, it doesnt have good storyline and its narrow and poorly written, the areas are way too ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and they feel like the developers have just slapped as much as they can in one place without any real purpose. Non recommandé
0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 juin 2018
Produit remboursé

I would absolutely not reccomend this game. When I started it, the graphics settings all default to ULTRA, meaning it runs terribly on my computer which, while not exactly top of the line, is powerful enough to run most games. I go to turn down the graphics, only to discover that no graphics setting can be set below MEDIUM, and Antialiasing can't be set below HIGH. Setting Downward to its "minimum" graphics settings did little to reduce the drain on my computer, but I decided to keep playing, despite the low framerate making precise platforming very difficult. When I defeated the Golem, it took several restarts of the game for the Dry Artifact to actually spawn and allow me to progress, an issue which Caracal Games purportedly fixed in the demo. I had high hopes for this game, but what I got was sorely disappointing. I wish I could enjoy this game. I really do. Sadly, however, it fell short of every expectation I had of it, including being a functional game.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation

Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2018
Huh, UE4, easily to build fascinating sences right ? But there's a big problem, the shiny things under the blinding bloom is so hard to notice. Yup, I can set the brightness, but don't forget how frequently bright and dark it changes, especially in challenges, do I really need to keep brightness satisfying anytime ?
The worst thing is that there are so many SEVERE BUGS in the game.
I reported them but seems no one gives a ♥♥♥♥.
-"Slingshot", sucks, it will unpredictably pull you away fast. maybe it's funny in story mode, but not in challenge. It means there is 80% chance to fail at this try.
-Sometimes land on deep water but still fall to die, once the character even didn't die fully, locked death view, can still move, jump, blew up by drones but still "alive" like a zombie keeping looking at the sky.
-If hit the edges (or near) of wall-jump walls of wall-run walls, it will be strange.
-Can hardly control the direction on "Glide" but can quickly go to another side after almost fall from one side.
-Even have a problem at the main menu, needs to click twice.

The game is great, parkour is exciting, the story is not so bad but some fatal problems really anger me.
I've collected most of collective things, it's a pity doesn't have a map the marks where the rest of them are.

0
Non recommandé
0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juillet 2017
Produit remboursé

After update v1.01:

The game looked good in screenshots and reviews, but i cant recommend it.

In the end i refunded because the game ran very poorly for a UE game. Setting the FPS to unlocked seemed to max out at 60FPS. Actually changing it to anything seems to have no effect (use 'stat fps' in the console to check). A lot of my problems are my monitor is 75hz so 60 can feel choppy, the game only has options for 60, 90 and some above that.

The visuals are great in screenshots, but in play i found the visuals marred by "pretty for screenshot" features. Motion blur is on by default and even on ultra things look blurry (even at native resolution). You cant fully disable AA or choose the type of AA. "post processing" is also not fully disablable which i think must include depth of field, which makes distant objects extremely blurry.

The parqour aspect passable for this price tag, but dont expect mirrors edge. Specfically the motion is choppy and appears to be a sequence animations with non smooth transitions.

Honestly if the performance a graphics issues could be resolved i would eat this up.
 
bigtallbill
1
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Évaluation publiée le 2 mars 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

Avis donné pendant l'accès anticipé

PARKOUR? NO, PLATFORM (Downward) - Accesso Anticipato
Downward si spaccia per un gioco di parkour, ma è un platform in prima persona puro e semplice. Rovine sospese nel vuoto, un sacco di salti, cristalli, savepoint piazzabili a volontà. Cosa non funziona?

Vidéo YouTube™: PARKOUR? NO, PLATFORM (Downward) - Accesso Anticipato 
Vues : 678
Downward si spaccia per un gioco di parkour, ma è un platform in prima persona puro e semplice. Rovine sospese nel vuoto, un sacco di salti, cristalli, savepoint piazzabili a volontà.

Non recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 avril 2018
The game itself isn't the worst thing in the world, in fact I was kind of digging it...until I saw that my GTX 1080 was at 79c.

I couldn't get the game to uncap the framerate despite the setting being set to "uncapped" in the options, this is kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ because I play on a 1080p 144hz monitor, that being said my GPU is absolute overkill for 1080p if I'm not going for high framerates; and high framerates are almost a must for me as playing first-person games under 100fps tends to give me motion sickness, as does depth of field and motion blur. Luckily you CAN turn motion blur off in the options but not DoF.

After playing for about an hour the 60 fps and DoF was getting to me so I had to stop and then I noticed my GPU was at 79c, I immediately rebooted the game and turned settings to minimum, capped framerate at 30 (because for some ♥♥♥♥-all reason you can cap it at 30 but not uncap it) and my temperatures still stayed well over 70c, this is insane to me, I played Far Cry 5 for like 4 hours straight yesterday and my GPU never got over 71c on max settings with uncapped framerate.

The game itself isn't bad though, if you can tolerate DoF and don't mind melting your GPU then this game is a solid Metroidvania-meets-parkour-meets-collectathon, I was really enjoying it, if I could've gotten my framerate to uncap, turned DoF off and my 1080 wasn't crying for me to put a bullet in it whilst playing it would be an 8/10, ESPECIALLY for the price, but it gets a 3/10 instead.

EDIT: If you are so upset that you're too poor to afford a 144hz monitor don't you think a better use of your time would be getting a job instead of commenting on my review?
 
The Uber Camper

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
14.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 décembre 2023
Excellent parkour game set in a funky fantasy world. Graphics are great for an indie title. Lots of cool upgrades like the equivalent of a double jump and grappling hook.

Maxing out all the character upgrades and defensive buffs is a grind. I also recommend saving before advancing the plot each time due to bugs. Don't let that be a deterrent, it's a short game.

3/5: for fans of Hot Lava and Mirrors Edge
 
MTeck

Viel Potential das leider nicht ausgeschöpft werden konnte.
Die Bugs machen das Spiel, sobald sie auftreten, unspielbar.

Leider treten die Bugs sehr häufig auf, was dafür sorgt, dass man das Spiel oft neustarten muss.

Außerdem hatte ich auch einen Bug der dafür gesorgt hat, dass ich den finalen Kampf antreten musste, obwohl ich ausgewählt habe, dass ich dafür noch nicht bereit sei.
Da das Spiel danach sofort beendet ist, und man einen alten Speicherpunkt laden muss um weiter spielen zu können, war damit für mich klar, dass ich den Rest nicht erforschen werde.

Non recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 avril 2023
It promises parkour. What you get is jank.

The ledges you can climb are predesignated. The walls you can run on are predesignated. There is no actual parkour. There is a specific course through a level. You can't climb that ledge you can obviously reach because it's not predesignated as such and you can actually climb that ledge you obviously missed by a mile because it is designated as such and your character WILL climb the same wall repeatedly just to make it up there.

Even worse the game gives you a mark. This mark is INDISPENSABLE. Because it functions as a way to teleport yourself back out of certain death. What is the certain death? The game janking up and launching you halfway across the map. Falling out of bounds trying to climb a wall. Using the powers in the game momentum and instead of being pulled up towards the grapplepoint you get LAUNCHED 200 feet into the air. The only thing that can possible save you is pressing F. Not to pay respect but to save your ass by teleporting out of lethal fall damage.

Setting you back multiple minutes of gameplay vs potentially an hour. Because the game ♥♥♥♥♥♥ up.

Definitely an interesting concept but half backed and not worth the money.

6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 septembre 2022
I am very interested in this game and the story, but it feels so disjointed and like there are story beats and context that are completely missing. Sometimes the game will suggest you do something which causes you to stop making progress because it's misleading from what you're actually supposed to do. In addition, it's very poorly optimized and runs like molasses no matter how much I try to turn down the settings. I keep getting game-breaking bugs that make me have to exit out of the game and load back in to my last save point.

What's worse is that I think it was actually not as broken the last time I tried to play it about a year ago.

I feel like this could be a really good and engaging game if it had some better optimization and player direction, but until then it's pretty frustrating to play and as a result I cannot recommend it.

Non recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2022
anyone played or considered playing downward?
its a parkour game with quite a big open world. some mayan-like + astrology lore, that somehow encourages you to free-roam alot around the map to find your own path
"somehow" that is false, because only very specific blue walls can be runned up or sideways on them, or even jumped from them
let me go into detail here, there are orange coloured walls, where you can wallrun only horizontally on them, there are red walls where you can only wallrun vertical [up] on them, and then theres the blue walls that you cal only jump to and from them [mind you, there aint some kind of ledges that you can grab upon them, no no no]
perfectly flat, and perfectly clean walls, that you can do only very certain moves on them, for a game that encourages free-style and free-roaming, its extremly specific on what you can or cant do, where or when
now, that somehow its okay, but there are 2 huge problems that come here
the first, visually, the lighting is horrible, its way too bright, you can turn down the brightness and gamma sepparatelly, but that just makes the screen extremelly dark and red, so its either too bright or too dark
the 2nd problem here, its so buggy, its so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ buggy, you have this dash move, that well, lets you dash, like 3 seconds ahead or any cardinal direction upon moving [now they were smart here, and didnt allow you to jump whilst dashing, i dont know why, for a free-style/free-roam game, dash-jumping aint allowed?, well no problem here], because, there are these very common "jump" pads, that lets you keep momentum when you use them, including dash, and might i remind you, the dash, its a huge, huge travel distance, combine it with a jump pad....
another thing, sometimes when you jump on a wall, for some reason, you just get stuck in the wall, randomly, or loose all momentum, the wall running mechanic [] also keeps momentum, BUT ALSO velocity direction, meaning that you can quite literary wall run DOWNSIDE if you mess just a little, on what would be otherwise, an intuitivelly just good wallrun, you somehow just plummet downwards
for as specific the game is on where, when and how it wants you to go, you can skip massive points in the game, and have the cutscenes be played in a completly mixed order, and you wouldnt even know it, cuz you "free-roamed" to your hearts content
its a shame, if the graphics were working, it woulda been a very nice parkour game, if the game wasnt buggy, it wouldve had a very decent and fun gameplay, with a lore [that while its not terrible, it wont bore you tho, some funny characters here and there too
ah, the hud sometimes just dissapears and you have to restart the game to have it again
theres this portals that, you can use the as fast-travel, as a land-mark based system, but, you cant use them, cuz its buggy
again, its a shame, im actually upset that the game is so broken, was looking forward to it
 
Trezor

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
9.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juillet 2022
Downward is a first-person metroidvania where the bulk of the gameplay revolves around parkouresque things like jumping between precipitous platforms, walljumps, climbing, wallrunning, and combinations of these. You eventually unlock additional features like bounce vortices and a hookshotlike thing that allow you to use previously untraversable routes. Wrapped around this is a Mystlike plot of helping a disembodied voice gather macguffins for nebulous reasons.

I found the gameplay itself enjoyable, challenging enough to be interesting without being frustrating. However, the combination of the open world layout and the extremely linear progression from objective to objective became extremely aggravating. After the third or so time I got moderately deep into exploring some out-of-the-way path that I found only to be roadblocked, I gave up and started blindly following the objective reticle from cutscene to cutscene.

Graphically, it looks pretty good. It did keep the fan on the steam deck running high basically all the time, but it also ran via proton on ultra settings, so 🤷. (I know it has a native linux build, but the native linux build crashes consistently for me in the loading screens.) It also made good use of ambient audio to give additional information about the environment/enemies/pickups/etc.

Overall, I'd say that I enjoyed playing Downward, but it has enough issues that I'd hesitate to recommend it to someone else.
 
Tak!

10.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2022
At first I taught this game will be just another little studio forgotten creation, but as I continued to play it, I realised that I was having fun with it.
The graphics are awesome (Unreal Engine), the story is good, not phenomenal, but good. The characters leave something to be desired for, even though there are not so many, and the gameplay has some problems, but I can get by that and say, this game is fun.
It has some mechanics that I really didn't think some little company could implement into their game, but I was surprised to see chnages in evnviroments, objects to collect, upgrades to buy, even a race mode with custom made races.
I recommend you play this game for yourself, sure there are some problems, but then again, not such a big company of games worked on it.

Non recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 février 2022
Requested a refund for this due to performance issue.

The game runs great on my system, 60+ frames on 4k/Ultra settings, but the load times if you take a death are insane. On my first death I was shocked at how long it took to get back into the game, I thought I was exaggerating so when the game(finally) loaded back up I took a 2nd death intentionally but set a stopwatch to see exactly what I was looking at. 2:47! Two minutes and forty-seven seconds! To load after EACH DEATH? I've got about half an hour's game time registered, and 20% of that was time spent waiting for the game to reload.

Nahhh I'm gonna put this one back on the shelf. I'm not sure if this was a one-off and things get better the further into the game you get somehow, but the refund window is tight and the game just wasn't compelling enough for me to take the risk. Sorry.
 
Jesus, Joel!

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 février 2022
Very buggy game. In all of my game sessions I had several game breaking bugs and glitches, but nonetheless I enjoy the gameplay, the voice acting and the lovely created world (wallpaper quality stuff) so much, that I recommend it! It's rather a slow parkour game like Mirror's Edge speed, but complex enough to keep you engaged. Plus getting the gold times in the challenges is fun.

There is no save and quit option, so all progress since the last save at a bell is lost when a bug/glitch appears. This is annoying and led me to saving more often. Bugs/glitches I encountered within 5 hours:
- character model turned upside down and fell into the sky
- clip through walls by just crouching (but I could get back)
- jumped onto a ledge and clipped into it without an option to get out
- walljumps not triggering although being directly on them and pressing jump. This is especially annoying in the challenges where every second counts.
- Golem type enemies' AoE attack not showing spikes
- I took mortal damage (0 hp left) from golem attack and got a staggered camera. I didn't die, but could move on with a wiggling camera and couldn't turn around. Then I walked into a cactus and got the achievement "died from a cactus", but still didn't die. I had to return to menu and lose progress again.

Gladly there are many save points, so you don't lose much progress. I enjoy the game and wanna 100% it. I recommend it!
 
Linkblade

Recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 novembre 2021
Blinded by the light
Revved up like a Deuce
Another runner in the night

Yeah, this game is really really bright. But jokes aside, I wasn't expecting to like it so much, actually I wasn't expecting to like this game at all, after completing the tutorial I started getting into it and dropping down from the cliff and emerging in the main hub made me realize how pretty it looks, amazing graphics for a small indie game, and the sensation I had all the time while exploring and jumping around was that of visiting a dream. The enemies and the story aren't that inspired but the parkour is great and I had lots of fun during the whole time I was playing, I loved picking up the collectibles and reading their description, especially the personal stories of every chess piece. I was surprised to see that the team is Italian and especially that the main voice actor was Paride from ThePruld. I have some critiques too, the sound design felt lacking at best since the game was strangely silent most of the time, the final boss fight was somewhat frustrating without unlocking many skills, picking up most collectibles felt unrewarding and some spaces felt too uselessly open. Those few points aren't enough to stop me from recommending this game to anyone, even if personally I wouldn't play through it a second time. Those sceneries will certainly affect my dreams the next few days.

I hope Caracal Games will develop more games

Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
달리고 점프해라

달리고 점프하는 게임입니다.
주변을 돌아다니면서 토큰 같은 것들을 수집할 수 있으며,
이를 일정 수 모아서 특정 능력들을 개방하는데 사용할 수 있죠.
물론, 개방을 위해서는 어느정도 진행하여 조각상을 이용해야만 가능!

기본적인 점프 외에 슬라이드나 벽타기, 오르기 등이 가능하며
이를 통해 특정 지형들을 진행할 수 있지만 이를 알아보기가 조금 애매하여
은근 맵을 자세히 봐야하기도 합니다.
올라갈 수 있는 지형인듯하며서 안된다거나 벽을 타고 달릴 수 있을 것 같은대 안된다거나...

그러면서 레이저로 플레이어를 인식해 공격하는 녀석을 피하기도 하고
골렘 같은 녀석의 공격을 피하여 코어를 해제시키기도 해야하죠.
코어를 얻어 잠겨있는 게이트를 해제하면서 진행하기도 합니다.

생각보다 다른 파쿠르 종류의 게임들보다는 조작이 그렇게 어렵다거나
손을 많이 타는 느낌은 들지 않더군요.
뭔가 내 의도와 다르게 멀리 간다거나 착지 지점이 이상하다거나 같은.

아쉬운 점
-지형 인식이 조금 어려움
 
Napols
1,820 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
70.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2021
Ok so this game is pretty darn good, When playing indie games you kind of set you expectations low but it is a solid game.
the good:
- Good controller support
- Solid locomotion mechanics
- Cheesy jokes sprinkeled in, mostly by the protagonist. I hope there is more dialogue written for him in the future because he is the right amount of witty without being an a**
-Good textures
- While the enemies are repetitive they put you in different situations so you can not use the same strategy over keeping it fresh
- Easy to understand but practical upgrade system
-The game doesn't encourage you to explore but doesn't punish you either. This means you can do the story straight or go up ahead a bit making the experience feel like you have the control.
-The bad
- The game doesn't hold your hand enough to explain all of its mechanics, for example you can design the old mans lair, I would have never known that if I didn't accidentally stumble on the custom book behind him.
- The story is meant to be vague to a certain extent but to really enjoy it you have to ignore glaring questions "like why the hell is he so helpful? because he has nothing better to do?"
- Small variety of enemies
- NO MAP! while the map isn't "needed" per say and there is a fast travel system it is disappointing when you can't remember what place is which direction. I have gone to the same place thinking I discovered something new only to learn there was more than one path to the same portal.

All in all it's worth it, buy it. Give it a chance and don't judge the whole game by the first 30 minutes. Remember the first sniper elite? they built a solid game then made it better and better with every new installment. This game could be the next sniper elite, but only if you support the devs buy buying it.

hutson797
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2021
Es un juego relativamente corto pero increíble en sus mecánicas. Tardé un par de días pero porque me gusta rebuscar los coleccionables que tiene. Es una mezcla entre parkour y luego tiene un poco de combate pacifista. Si lo jugáis, sabréis por qué lo digo.

Una de las cosas malas que tiene el juego es la poca repercusión que ha tenido y que eso llevase a una guía o mapas para orientarse mejor y no perderse ninguno de los coleccionables que antes dije.
Otra de las cosas malas están en los logros. Yo que soy un enfermo de los logros me dio lástima que no haya recompensa alguna por encontrar todos los coleccionables. Sólo te pide una cantidad arbitraria que no son el total. Y luego que no hay ningún logro sobre pasarse el juego. No sé. Desalienta bastante. Es como si te dijeran de forma condescendiente que el juego no es para tanto, pero no pienso eso. Me ha gustado mucho.

Pasando a la parte buena el control del personaje es muy satisfactorio y las mecánicas que tiene dan pie a combinarlas para hacer cosas muy locas como catapultarte hacia el cielo hasta tal punto que el mundo se descargue por distancia de render y luego al caer se vea cómo se vuelve a cargar. Evidentemente esto tiene pinta de bug pero tengo la sensación que podía forzarlo de alguna forma.
Es este juego tan agradable que invita a probar estas cosas. Y luego tiene un diseño de mapas increíblemente coherente. Tiene muchos detalles, muy colorido, mucha conexión... Se ve que han intentado "disimular" las plataformas para que tenga una lógica conjunta.
Luego el dinamismo que le da los combates a esta experiencia hace que no te aburras en los instantes de descanso del parkour.

No es un juego fácil por mucho que el mismo juego te vaya acompañando y aconsejando en todo momento. Hay que tener cierta habilidad y manejo en los controles. Aun así, al no ser tan largo, no veo mal darle un intento.

La historia y la banda sonora no son nada del otro mundo, pero si has venido aquí es para hacer parkour, ver sitios bonitos y dejarte llevar por la curiosidad.
 
ZodyarkXV

Non recommandé
10.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 octobre 2021
Downward is a fitting name for a game that starts off ordinary and then gets progressively worse. The concept of altering environments to reveal divergent paths and visuals is interesting but wasted here, as for the parkour itself - sloppy and monotonous. The story is meritless and every character is thoroughly annoying, the old man is a perfect example of botched eccentricity horrendously backfiring and deserves particular ire. Enemy appearance and combat is astonishingly bad and by far the worst aspect of this mess, I can't recall the last time I was legitimately offended by AI behaviour.

Let this serve as a warning sign before you plunge from the cliff of your curiosity.

4/10
 
ΤΣΠΠΘ

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2021
Pretty open world with very high tolerance for sequence breaking. Parkour mechanics can be buggy at times, but I personally found it fun to see how I could exploit dashes and ledge grabs to get to places I shouldn't be. The critical path itself is also fun, with decently challenging platforming and the occasional combat encounter. The combat itself isn't great (mostly just dodging and waiting for a particular attack that leaves the enemy vulnerable), and there's quite a bit of it required to collect the resource that gates progression, but the fights tend to be quite short compared to the time spent running around and exploring.
 
Ricky Slugface
1,289 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2021
Artılar:
+Grafikleri şahsen beğendim
+Mekanlar güzel duruyor
+Parkur oyunu sevenler için oynanabilir bir oyun

Eksiler
-Senaryo anlatımı yok
-Bazen mekaniklerin basitliği sizin sonunuz olabiliyor
-BİR İNSAN NASIL KAKTÜSE DOKUNARAK ÖLEBİLİR
-Yeri geldiğinde tekrardan sizi delirtebiliyor
-Save noktaları çok çok az
-Parkur oyunu diyince şöyle bir müzik olsaydı iyiydi gaza gelirdik oynamaya değerdi
-Bir süre sonra buglar ile de tanışıyorsun ve fazladan yarım saat falan yiyor, bir yerde öldükten sonra tekrar uyanınca canın azalıyor ve ölüyorsun. Bu durum sen yeniden başlatana kdar sürüyor.

Sonuç:
Oyun "sadece" parkur oyunu olarak güzel, her türlü parkur oynarım derseniz 1 kere indirimdeyken alın oynayın ve kaldırın parkur tadını çıkartın yeterli...

Queria poder recomendar esse jogo porque tem conceitos interessantes mas... não dá... A jogabilidade não é muito boa, e ela não tem o feeling pra entrar no flow do jogo, como em mirror's edge, lemma, titanfall ou hot lava. Ela não é responsiva. Peguei na promoção e mesmo assim não curti.

141 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juin 2020
Из плюсов - отличный паркур. Вот прям в лучших традициях "Mirror's Edge", наверное. Если интересно, каково бы бегалось Фейт не в городе будущего, а руинах, то попробовать стоит.

Из минусов - не увлекает особо. Ну и что, что огромный остров. "Читается" окружение не так уж хорошо, как хотелось бы, да и задачи тут, по сути, "пробегись отсюда в самую дальнюю точку мира".
За час встречаешь толпу одинаковых боссов-врагов, непобедимых летающих мин и всякие отображения абилок, которые ещё даже не открыты. Впечатление сформировалось из путаницы, бэктрекинга и скудности происходящего.

Надо ли говорить, что сюжет... просто шёл. Ну идёт там какая-то история. Неинтересно, короче.


Не хочу рекомендовать, раз сам забросил.

Kalgalanos
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2020
Mehr Reviews gibt es auf meiner Kuratorseite

Downward ist ein Parkour Platformer mit einem großen Fokus auf Erkundung. Storytechnisch ist das Spiel in einer Postapokalypse angesiedelt, wo es nur noch wenige Tiere und Pflanzen gibt.
Durch die Level bewegt man sich mit Parkourmoves. So kann der Hauptcharakter an Wänden laufen und *ting* Wandsprünge machen. Zu den normalen Bewegungen erhält man noch einen Doppelsprung, welcher es ermöglicht von kleinen Luftwirbeln erneut abzuspringen, sowie einen Enterhaken mit dem man sich an funkensprühenden Punkten ranziehen kann. Später ist es auch möglich *ting* an bestimmten Stellen Plattformen erscheinen zu lassen, womit man wiederum an weitere Stellen im Level gelangen kann. Die Bewegungen fühlen sich die meiste Zeit gut an und lassen sich auch problemlos durchführen. Nur manchmal funktioniert die Kollisionsabfrage nicht richtig und das Festhalten funktioniert nicht oder man bleibt auch manchmal *ting* kurz in der Wand stecken. Und falls man trotzdem mal fallen sollte so hat der Spieler die Fähigkeit The Mark, welche es ihm erlaubt Punkte zu markieren und sich auf Knopfdruck direkt wieder an diese zu teleportieren.
Die Level sind dabei allesamt interessant gestalten mit unterschiedlichen Umgebungen. Sie sind zwar durch die Postapokalypse etwas trist, aber dafür spieltechnisch sehr gut. Zudem lassen sich die Level durch den Einfluss von drei *ting* Planeten noch verändern. Ein Planet lässt bestimmte Objekte im Level schweben, der zweite lässt die Hitze und somit Lava steigen und der letzte beeinflusst das Wasser. Durch das aktivieren eines Planeten kann man weitere Bereiche in einem Level erreichen und somit mehr Sachen zum Sammeln finden.
Denn neben der Hauptaufgabe gibt es noch eine Menge Dinge zu finden. Zu Sammeln gibt es leuchtende Punkte die Skypieces, welche eine *ting* Währung für Upgrades sind. Dann gibt es noch die Dry Artifacts. Diese werden für das Öffnen von Lichttüren gebraucht. Normale Artefakte gibt es ebenfalls, diese lassen sich gegen Skypieces tauschen. Knochen eines Toten sucht man um diesen wieder zusammenzusetzen und zu guter Letzt gibt es noch *ting* Mechaniken, welche aktiviert werden können. Für das normale Ende braucht man außer ein paar Dry Artifacts nicht weiter zu sammeln, das Meiste ist also rein optional. Wenn man jedoch die zwei alternativen Enden freispielen möchte, kommt man am Sammeln nicht vorbei.
Als Gegner gibt es nur *ting* Drohnen und Golems, mehr nicht. Da das Spiel nicht allzu lang ist, ist es hier noch vertretbar. Drohnen verfolgen den Spieler, wenn sie ihn sehen, bis man sich aus ihrem Bewegungsradius entfernt. Und Golems sind Hüter von Dry Artifacts und als Minibosse zu sehen. Beide Gegner besiegt man, indem man die korrekten Stellen berührt. Bei Drohnen den Rückenkristall und bei den Golems die Artefakte, wenn sie aufhören rot zu leuchten.
Technisch ist das Spiel auch nicht ganz sauber, denn neben den oben genannten Kollisionsproblemen, kann man sich auch mal schnell softlocken, wenn man während der Sterbeanimation *ting* erneut getroffen wird.

Grafisch sieht das Spiel ganz hübsch aus und läuft auch mit einer guten Framerate auf höchsten Einstellungen (PC: i7 4790k, 16GB Ram, GTX 1070Ti). Die einzelnen *ting* Level sehen grafisch auch alle Unterschiedlich aus und trotz wenigen Pflanzen ist das Spiel nicht durch und durch braun, sondern hat auch viel Farben. Aber ein großen Problem ist die Beleuchtung. Das Spiel ist an vielen Stellen viel zu hell, sodass man die Interaktionspunkte für Doppelsprünge oder den Enterhaken gerne mal nicht sieht. An anderen Stellen ist das Spiel viel zu dunkel.

Kommen wir nun zum Sounddesign, welches durchaus verbesserungswürdig ist. So gibt es im Spiel, außer bei den Bosskämpfen keine merkliche Musik. Und wie im Review immer wieder eingebaut gibt es ein schönes *ting* Geräusch, wenn man ein Skypiece einsammelt. Jedes mal. Das ist auf Dauer sehr nervig. Ein weiteres unpassendes Geräusch ist das erscheinen von Drohnen im letzten Bosskampf. Diese ploppen mit einem schönen Geräusch, als wenn einer den Daumen aus einer Flasche zieht, auf. Alle anderen Soundeffekte sind aber in Ordnung.
Alle Dialoge sind voll vertont und die Stimmen passen auch zu den Charakteren. Einzig dass der Hauptcharakter alle eingesammelten Artefakte und geöffneten Türen kommentieren muss, ist sehr lästig, besonders da er nur sehr wenige Sprüche hierfür auf Lager hat. Zudem nervt der Witz“That‘s a-door-able“ beim Öffnen von Türen doch sehr schnell und man sollte den Charakter für den Flachwitz doch mal schlagen.

Alles in allem ist Downward trotz diverser Bugs und nerviger Soundeffekte aber ein durchaus gutes Spiel, was man gerne mal spielen kann, sofern man Parokourplatformer und Erkunden mag. Das Spiel ist auch nicht allzu lang (2Std für normales Ende, 6Std für die anderen Enden) und kostet auch nicht viel. Eine Empfehlung von mir.
 
Erim
3,752 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2020
春节打折10块钱买的，说说个人游玩感受：
优点
1）画风漂亮，配置要求一般
游戏的画质或许不算好，但画风实属舒服。尤其是光晕与水面部分极其漂亮；1660TI,I5 9400全高画质在1080P下毫无卡顿。
2）镜头晃动极佳
在进行各种跑酷动作和战斗时的镜头晃动简直绝了，除了带感我想不到别的形容词。当然对于3D眩晕症的人来说这可能就是噩梦。
3）地图设计优秀
游戏的背景故事中，三颗外星球突然出现在地球附近，导致了地球的剧烈变化，无数人类和物种丧失生命，主角等人称其为apocalypse（末世）。在游戏里你也可以看到三颗星球环绕着地球旋转。大气，云朵与星球交相辉映，那种特有的美感只有自己在游戏里才能体会到。

缺点
1）没有中文
虽然游戏的词汇比较简单，处于cet4-cet6之间，但对于中国玩家来说，没有中文多多少少有点不方便。如果你英语不是特别好，玩这游戏就相当于在做听力和阅读了。
2）游戏提示较少
除了按住Q能将镜头对准当前目标，以及一些基本的操作说明之外，这游戏就没有其它的任何提示了，一切都要自己去探索。而且地图有点绕，对于像我这样的路痴来说，迷路是件很正常的事情。

以上就是玩了两个多小时的感受，总的来说这游戏还是可以一试的。虽然没有镜之边缘或消逝的光芒那么完美，但也可以让人感受到跑酷的快感

 
tempest

ghostyghast
247 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 juillet 2019
It's a first person free-running platformer. It's pretty fun to just jump around and explore and stuff, and it's beautiful to look at. Overall, it feels nice to play, and I'll recommend this game for how cool it feels to do acrobatics. It's prince of Persia, but with a hook-shot and making platforms appear. The gameplay is just fun and it's beautiful to look at.

Now to the things I don't like about it.

It's not all fine and well, though. I'm gonna spoil it here, by the way, but if you haven't seen the finale coming, you must live in the Andromeda galaxy with your eyes closed, that's how obvious it is. MC is told several times not to trust the disembodied voice, is told that the things he collects are of massive power. Then he asks the disembodied voice "what are you gonna use this for?" the voice says cryptically something about "changing the world, that's all you need to know," but the MC is in a position to bargain for more info since he's the one getting ♥♥♥♥ done, but he doesn't push it further, just tells himself "I should be careful about giving this disembodied voice access to these relics," and then, in order to continue the game, proceeds to give it the relics and oof, oh, it's a bad guy, "surprise".


There are physics-bugs, such as when you jump on one of those moving platforms and crouch, you can't un-crouch or jump, which luckily isn't as big a deal as it sounds, since there's like 2 moving platforms in the game, but it still had me dropping down and starting a jumping puzzle over.
Occasionally when you wall-jump, the character will turn to face the wall you're jumping on, ruining the jump.
The MC's continued 'puns', specifically "it's a door-able!" when he opens a door is absolutely horrible when heard over and over.
I mentioned the graphics were beautiful, and they are, but the most difficult jumping puzzle I faced was when the sun prohibited me from seeing a near-invisible platform that I had to make to land on. That's not a puzzle, that's just bad design.
The biggest "bruh-moment" I had, however, was when I fought a golem, and the brick that you're supposed to collect flew out of it and glitched through a wall.


In summary:
Platforming/gameplay is splendid fun with good flow, which, to me, is one of the most important things!
Combat is dodge-based and kind of dull, but fortunately there isn't a lot of it.
The physics engine sometimes bugs out and prevents a 100 % completion from being possible.
Wall-jumping is a tiny bit iffy sometimes.
The graphics are gorgeous , but one can have too much lens flare.
The MC is insufferable and the writing is just straight up bad.

If you liked Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time, but didn't like the combat and don't care about the story, you'll like this.
 
James Clerk Maxwell
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.2 h en tout

Absolutely perfect for me.

-Open World, First-Person, Adventure/Exploration in a stunning world.
-Freedom to replay and see different endings
-Plenty of mechanics to master
-TONS of collectibles to find
-Interesting Character Personalities.

Currently my favorite game

Non recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2019
As much as I want to enjoy Downward, with it's great style, cool concept, and what should be enjoyable gameplay, I can't. For starters, the graphics are buggy as all hell. I usually wouldn't see this as an issue, but considering this game seems to be aesthetic-based, this is a rather large issue. The script is alright, but the delivery is sub-par. It attempts at an open-world aspect, which I can respect, but how they go about it is... not too great. Past the tutorial you're quite literally dropped into a large area with no general objective. Downward has great potential to be a fantastic first-person parkour adventure game, but in it's current state, it's merely a husk of what it could be.
 
Doktor of Questionable Authority

Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2019
Per quanto mi piacciano i giochi parkour e questo sia anche italiano, devo dire che non ci siamo.
Lo shake della camera è esagerato, fa quasi venire il mal di stomaco, i controlli non sono responsivi (cosa abbastanza grave, sono caduto spesso, nonostante spammassi il tasto sinistro quella cacchio di piattaforma non si creava).
Il gioco è un po' buggato ma ci può stare, non mi aspetto la perfezione, però ce n'è uno davvero orribile che si è presentato spesso: se durante l'animazione di morte il player ne fa un'altra (es: si aggrappa a qualcosa o viene ricolpito) entra in uno stato di immortalità in cui non puoi fare niente se non camminare e saltare. Non prende danno e non può più morire e sei costretto a tornare al menù principale.
La trama è abbastanza stupida, il doppiaggio italiano (sopratutto del vecchio) è orribile e.... avete uppato una build su steam in modalità development ragazzi, c'è la console comandi attiva...........

986 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
11.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juin 2019
I really want to like this game more, but any recommendation I can give is shaky at best.

Let's start with the good: if you're looking for a game with beautiful environments to casually parkour through and nothing more, you might have fun with Downward (but buy it on sale).

Once you get past that initial awe, however, the game turns out to be pretty disappointingly shallow - unless you're the type that enjoys collection quests or parkour time trials/mini challenges. The story/characters are one-dimensional and don't make much sense, some of the mechanics were annoying due to occasional glitches or if you didn't aim perfectly, and the game doesn't really present any interesting obstacles (area bosses are a joke). The final boss was frustrating because it ended up being a series of fails until I got lucky enough to get it right (you have no offensive tactics, so you're just trying to avoid damage as much as possible while platforming back and forth).

If you're only interested in a mostly easy-going parkour experience with some eye candy, you might find some enjoyment, but don't expect anything on the same level as Mirror's Edge, which was much more thoughtful in its design and challenge.
 
stoneinfocus

123

0
Recommandé
13.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juin 2019
몇년 전에 샀던 게임인데, 이제서야 히든엔딩을 봤다.
후반으로 갈수록 실망이 더 많았으나, 적어도 액션은 만족했기에 추천을 준다.


게임 진행

플레이어는 누군가에 의해 엉뚱한 행성으로 워프당했다. 전직이 뭐였는지는 모르겠지만, 24시간 뛰어다닐 수 있는 체력, 그리고 강철같이 튼튼한 팔다리로 이 행성을 탐험해야 한다.

장르를 구분하자면 3D 플랫포머 + 파쿠르 + “수집”. 농담이 아니라 진심이다. 플탐의 80%는 벽에 매달리고, 벽을 달리고, 점프하고, 이동하는 시간이다. 여러 지역을 돌아다니며 메인 퀘스트를 해결하고, 더불어 경험치/돈(Skypiece)과 유물(Artifact)을 수집하는게 기본 방식.


그래픽 : 7점
텍스쳐, 모델링, 거기에 배경까지. 언리얼 엔진을 적절히 활용해 어색한 부분 없이 고퀄리티의 그래픽을 뽑아냈다. 구도만 잘 잡는다면 상점 페이지의 스샷처럼 배경화면으로 써도 손색이 없을 정도. (다만, 그래픽카드가 GTX1080이라 최적화는 확인하지 못했다.)

그러나, 광원(빛) 처리에서 모든 점수를 깎아먹는다.

기본적으로 햇빛이 너무 강렬하며, 너무 부자연스럽다. 그래서 햇빛이 비치는 구역은 너무 환하고 어두운 구역은 너무 어둡다. 그리고 상황에 따라 “밤”이 될 때도 있는데, 역시 부자연스러운건 똑같고, 파란빛이 너무 강렬해서 시력을 깎아먹는 기분이 든다.


액션 : 9점
그래도, 액션은 잘 살렸다. 현실에 기반을 둔 파쿠르 액션이지만, 더 먼거리를 뛴다든지, 더 높은 곳으로 올라간다든지 비현실적인 움직임이 가능하다. 그리고 3D 모델의 움직임도 자연스러워 불쾌한 골짜기를 건드리지 않는다.

대부분의 지역에 바닥이 없고, 허공을 주로 탐험하게 된다. 그래서 아슬아슬한 긴장감을 유지할 수 있으며, 고퀄리티의 그래픽으로 속도감과 활동성을 잘 느낄 수 있다.


스킬 시스템 : 5점
스킬 시스템이 있긴 있다. 총 35개로 스킬의 개수는 많은 편이나, 스킬의 효과가 절대적이지 않고 스킬업에 필요한 경험치를 그냥 퍼주기 때문에 무난하게 모든 스킬을 배울 수 있다.


스토리 : 4점
용두사미.
“용”도 아니고 “이무기”로 시작했다가 그저 “뱀”이 되었다.

게임의 시작부터 끝까지 명확한 스토리가 없다. 그렇다고 게임의 배경과 세계관이 설명되는 것도 아니다. 그저 행성을 구해야 한다며 플레이어에게 부탁을 할 뿐이고, 플레이어는 아무 의심 없이 그것을 따라간다.

그나마 맘에 들었던건, 특정한 조건을 만족한 뒤 나름의 반전이 있었다는 것. 그리고 히든 엔딩을 봤는데, 히든 엔딩을 봐도 대체 뭐가 달라진건지, 무슨 차이가 있는건지 전혀 알 수 없었다.
 
에닉스Enigs
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juin 2019
Downward has it's Charme but is definitely not Mirrors Edge.

A few things that bother me:
- It is very Easy. When you jump way to close the Game just pulls you 2 Meters in the Air to climb a ledge. Some places even got Designed with this in Mind so there is no way you would have any illusion of actually being good.
- The Combat is not very demanding either.
- The Skill-System is solid but with the points above in mind it feels very redundant to Skill anything.
- I am wondering that it seems to be Full Release. Besides of some Bugs i ran into i see missing Textures on Particle-Effects everywhere.
- While the Game tries to hold your Hand on every Step of the line and gives you many Video-Tutorials right from the Start, it leaves your Headscratching at others. I still don't know what these Lamps are for or how to Unlock the Anomalys with the missing Textures.
- There is a lot of politics going on and how bad human Nature is. I see it in the News and in Politics. I don't want to be lectured about it in the Games i play.
- The Visuals are a matter of Taste. I don't like this ultra vibrant look very much. Even with ReShade it wasn't easy to set an okeysh tone without having some Areas extremely Dark and others way to bright.

Overall i can say it is a very relaxing Game to Play with it's own Charme. Many things about it are a matter of Teste. To me it feels like it has many flaws.
 
МЇҊѲЅ

19.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2019
Very disappointed by this game. Yes the game gives little direction and the combat is bad, and the platforming controls are weird and very finnicky. But the bugs ruin it. There was 2 bugs, one of which was when I would die instead I would look up in the air but get stuck in the death animation without dying and being able to run around but not control the camera. Would have to restart game which was annoying since it started happening like 30-50% of the time, but not the end of the world. The biggest one was a game breaking bug that when I respawned at a specific point i spawned in the ground unable to move, but since theres only a single checkpoint save and no option to pick a different or manually save or get unstuck, it meant i had to redo the entire game. The biggest problem is that i had already played 33% of the game and didn't want to restart. After scouring forums i Found out that someone else had this problem 1.5 years ago and they said they would address it in an upcoming patch, and then NEVER DID. So im not going to waste time replaying this game from start because they can't be bothered to release the promised update fixing a game breaking bug that wouldn't be that hard to do. What a waste of time and money 3/10.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2019
A short but fun parkour game. However has a few shortfalls.

There is virtually no story to game. There are basic cutscenes and dialogues but feels very generic and broken. There is no background given for the next objective which makes the story feel very empty.
Visually the game looks good but has very poor draw distance which cannot be changed from the settings menu.

What is nice is that the world created is quite interesting. The planetary influence is a unique concept to play with.
Since it is an adventure game there is very little combat. The parkour is nice but does not feel fast pace as other similar games.
Difficulty wise the puzzles are not that difficult but are not too easy which is a good balance.

Despite all the problems, overall it delivers a lot considering it is an indie game which is why I would recommend.
 
HadriaN
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
21.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 janvier 2019
Good Game Thwarted by Impactful Bugs

This is a solid parkour game with a smidge of a story to keep you moving forward. Unfortunately, about once every two hours or so, you'll hit some kind of impactful bug that totally deflates your enthusiasm to continue playing. Key points:

  • In 4k on a 1080Ti, the graphics were good and I was impressed with the distance at which you could see the rest of a level. It would have been exceptional if distant enemies and objects were visible too.

  • It's possible for the camera, and thus your ability to turn left and right, to get stuck. You can go forward, backward, and strafe, but nothing else. Since you have to find and click on a bell to save your progress, this usually means you'll lose progress.

  • There are far too many clipping problems. You'll get stuck in a wall or ceiling and the only recourse is to quit and restart from the last save point. If you could at least warp back to your mark, this would just be a nuisance, but instead it's a major PITA.

  • When I first got fast travel to the merchant's lair, I'd end up in limbo falling forever. I think it worked later because I eventually bought all the rooms in the merchant's lair and the game was dumbly putting me where an unpurchased room would be.

  • When you've completed the first ending and are only playing to experience additional challenges, the distance at which icons appear on your radar should be greatly increased.

If the devs could squash these high-impact bugs, or at least make them less impactful, this would be solid must buy. As it stands, only buy this on sale if you like parkour games and can tolerate the bugs.
 
foaminator

Two different ends that will take you in total around 8 hours, but they feel a bit... empty. You don't really feel like you finished the game, but it stays pretty solid.

106 produits enregistrés
