Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 septembre 2018
It's a fun parkour game with some cool mechanics and impressive visuals and sound design.

That said, it's noticably more limited in its parkour elements than something like Mirror's Edge - which isn't surprising but it needs to be said.

Probably the biggest weakeness is the combat. Your protagonist has no means by which to attack - so it's very fortunate that all of the enemies have a weak spot that can be exploited with the "Use" key - and there are only 3 types of enemies.

Drones.
Golems.
And the sentry towers.

The drones can be dealt with by snagging the gem off their backs. With the golems, avoid their attacks until the Dry Artifacts buried in them turn blue - at which point quickly close the distance and snag all of them, which kills the golem. And the sentry towers will all shut down if you can find and disable the control tower.

I should say - that's the biggest *gameplay* weakness. I can deal with that. Probably the absolute worst part for me is the endings.

There are three endings - one standard and two 'secret'. All three are surprisingly lackluster, consisting of at most 30 seconds of one character speaking a few sentences. They're more than you would have gotten playing a classic Nintendo game - but given how much effort most of the rest of the game had put in it, the endings feel extremely lazy, like they didn't know how to end the story.

The story is pretty thin - but then, it's an action/RPG platformer. Subbstituting gameplay for story works just fine.

It's a fun game, and I recommend playing it if you liked Portal 2 and Mirror's Edge - and wouldn't be bothered by the removal of 90% of the story from both games.
 
white_knight_leo
0

Sviluppato da un team italiano, Downward è un'idea molto carina sebbene non troppo originale, un titolo parkour ambientato in scenari onirici e anche vari tra loro. Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2018
Ieri sera sfogliando tra i giochi di Steam ho notato questo gioco. Dalle immagini la grafica mi sembrava carina, dai gameplay mi è sembrato un giochino tranquillo così lo ho comprato.
Dopo averlo comprato ho notato che è stato fatto da una software house italiana e che era pure completamente in italiano (era tardi, non mi ero messo a guardare tutto del gioco, giusto un paio di gameplay su youtube fatti da inglesi).

Lo ho appena iniziato, ma è riuscito a tenermi fino ad ora tarda attaccato. Niente di speciale, ma comunque un buon prodotto per il prezzo a cui viene proposto. Se avete giocate ed apprezzato Valley come ho fatto io, apprezzerete ancor di più questo gioco. Meccaniche interessanti e ben realizzate, dialoghi divertenti ed anche se il doppiaggio non è professionale (perché non lodano il sole qua?) rende molto bene. Spero che continuino a produrre giochi. Io sono un programmatore, al momento lavoro come web developer, ma sogno di creare anche io un giorno un gioco tutto mio e sono felice di vedere persone ♥♥♥ lo stesso sogno che si sono messi di impegno per realizzarlo.

TLDR: Consiglio l'acquisto, il prezzo è onesto per un gioco che ti intratterrà per molte ore divertendoti.
 
FunCool
259 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

9.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mars 2018
Es un juego de parkour bastante fácil y si solo sigues la historia no dura más de cinco horas.
Es bonito artísticamente pero está mal optimizado y no es que sea puntero gráficamente. Por lo demás es disfrutable y relajante.

El final es un pelín frustrante dependiendo de qué tanto hayas subido la vida y la absorción de daño.
 
mariomorphine

Recommandé
14.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 février 2018
This being my first experience with a "parkour" game, I was not sure how I'd like it, but overall, it was pretty fun - even with keyboard and mouse (and not controller).

I think the designers did good job getting the player to learn each skill in time (although some explanation could have helped as I encountered these "things" in the game that I had no idea what to do with - for much of the game). I did not get the gist of the different planets until the end. I probably missed a good amount of content by not switching planets.

The game environment was pretty interesting. I felt I had way more resources than I wanted to spend, though, even considering that in game "death" is accompanied by resource loss. (Deaths were few and far between, so it was not much of an impact.)

Overall - a fun game.
 
pahhriah
0

Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2017
So this is Downward, and I'm reviewing the fully released version.
This game has a lot of good things going for it, great graphics, great exploration factors, and a main character who seems to comment on everything that's happening way too late. Overall great game, check out my gameplay footage!

Vues : 458
sorry about the audio, my mic messed up. Today we play the newly released full version of Downward. This is an open-world explorer with focuses on parkour and free-running.

Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2017
This surprised me! It's a very solid parkour game with a lot of hard challenges (which is good!) and the graphics are just beautiful! It's the kind of game where you find yourself moving your butt IRL in the direction you want to go as you jump off a ledge! Well done! I totally got into it!

6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 octobre 2017
Getting used it was a bit shakey as it doesn't guide you, but the experience of learning everything is refreshing in itself. The worlds and design is beautiful, the gameplay is fluent and relaxing. Lots of great little surprises when discovering the gameplay/mechanics and in the world itself. Heavy esotericism in the story. It can feel a bit isolated at times but it's nice.. it's peaceful and tranquil. Exploring the world at your own pace with the refreshingly pacifistic combat is one hell of a way to relax.
 
76561198106207970
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 octobre 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

This game is great, personally if I just need to relax, I'll go to this game. The controls are exactly like any other shooter on the market, so adapting is super easy. The graphics are gorgeous, and the story is interesting enough. Don't come in expecting a AAA experience, but this isn't some half baked project some guy did while drunk... This is a great game, with barely any bugs, that runs on Unreal Engine. The gameplay is really smooth and immersive.
 
Oromis95

I have encountered bugs only very seldom (thrice so far - I got stuck in an object) but quitting/continuing worked.
